articles.title: Bitcoin hovers near $90,000 after Trump eases Greenland tone. Here is what experts say
articles.summary: Bitcoin hovered near $90,000 after US President Donald Trump softened Greenland rhetoric, lifting risk assets. Modest daily gains followed heavy liquidations and weekly losses. Analysts see range-bound trading as policy signals, yields, and macro clarity remain uncertain amid volatile equities, cautious sentiment.

articles.title: European shares rebound as Trump withdraws tariff threats over Greenland
articles.summary: European shares rebounded on Thursday after U.S. President Donald ‌Trump ‌abandoned tariff threats linked to Greenland and ruled out ‌using force to seize the autonomous Danish territory.

articles.title: Global markets on a moving chessboard as sentiment overtakes fundamentals: Seth R Freeman
articles.summary: Seth R. Freeman observes that global markets are navigating persistent uncertainty driven by U.S. developments and a changing world order. He highlights risks stemming from shifting investor and consumer sentiment, potential policy impacts like credit card rate caps, and the continued influence of Donald Trump. Freeman suggests emerging markets, particularly India, are poised to benefit from these dynamics.

articles.title: From Tariffs to Turbulence: Trump’s moves test market nerves again
articles.summary: Global markets are on edge again as President Trump’s renewed tariff threats and geopolitical tensions revive the “Sell America” narrative. A broad risk-off move hit equities, Treasuries and the dollar, unsettling investors who now fear this volatility could prove more persistent as uncertainty over U.S.–Europe trade and Greenland tensions lingers.

articles.title: Rupee recovers 15 paise from all-time low to 91.50 against US dollar in early trade
articles.summary: The Indian Rupee has recovered from its lowest point against the US Dollar. This rebound follows positive sentiment after President Trump indicated no new tariffs on Europe. Domestic stock markets also saw gains, supporting the Rupee's recovery. However, global uncertainties and trade deal progress remain key factors influencing the currency's future stability.

articles.title: US revokes over 100,000 visas so far amid Trump crackdown; deportations to continue
articles.summary: America's State Department has cancelled over 100,000 visas this year. This action targets foreign nationals with criminal records or legal issues. The department states this is to keep America safe. This move affects tourists, students, and skilled workers. Indians, a large group of visa holders, are impacted. India is raising these concerns with Washington.

articles.title: Donald Trump tries to break the Fed. What the clash means for India
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the Justice Department served subpoenas threatening criminal indictment over his Senate testimony, which he calls a "pretext" to pressure the Fed on interest rates. President Trump denied knowledge but criticized Powell, escalating a conflict over central bank independence and monetary policy.

articles.title: 'Mogambo Khush Hua': Kharge likens Trump to iconic villain, questions Modi’s silence
Rupee recovers 15 paise from all-time low against dollar in early trade
articles.summary: The rupee rebounded from its alltime low levels and gained 15 paise to trade at 91.50 against the US dollar in early deals on Thursday, on improved risk appetite after Donald Trump said that he had no intention of applying tariffs on Europe for Greenland acquisition.

articles.title: Q3 Results LIVE Updates: IIFL Finance shares decline 10% post earnings; V-Mart net profit up 22%
articles.summary: Q3 Results LIVE Updates: Over 50 companies are reporting their results today including names such as Mphasis, Coforge, Bandhan Bank, APL Apollo Tubes, InterGlobe Aviation, Radico Khaitan, Premier Energies, Zensar Technologies, Indian Bank, Zee Entertainment, among others. There are also plenty of stocks that will be reacting to their results that were reported after market hours on Wednesday. Watch this space for all the LIVE Updates for the Q3 results.

articles.title: No Requirement To Issue Pre-Cognizance Notice U/S 223 BNSS To Accused In Cheque Bounce Complaint: Gauhati High Court
articles.summary: Relying on the Supreme Court's decision in Sanjabij Tari vs. Kishore S. Borcar 2025 LiveLaw (SC) 952 , the Gauhati High Court has held that a Magistrate is not required to issue notice to the accused at the pre-cognizance stage in a complaint under Section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments (NI) Act. articles.title: Student With Benchmark Disability Entitled To Fee Waiver Despite Not Being Admitted Under PwD Quota: Madras High Court
articles.summary: The Madras High Court recently came to the aid of a law student with chronic schizophrenia by directing the Tamil Nadu Dr Ambedkar Law University to provide fee waiver, as long as the student was within the 40% benchmark disability. Justice Bharatha Chakravarthy noted that the Tamil Nadu Government and the university had introduced the welfare scheme, providing a fee waiver for persons with disabilities, but it was being extended only to the persons admitted in the 5% quota earmarked for persons

articles.title: Excise Policy: Court Acquits Former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal In Cases Over Skipping ED Summons
articles.summary: A Delhi Court today acquitted former Delhi Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party supremo Arvind Kejriwal in cases concerning non compliance of Enforcement Directorate's summons in relation to the alleged liquor policy scam. Addl. Chief Judicial Magistrate Paras Dalal of Rouse Avenue Courts pronounced the verdict. A detailed order is awaited. articles.title: Is An Insolvency Professional A 'Public Servant' Under The Prevention Of Corruption Act, 1988?
articles.summary: India's Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016 (IBC), relies on Insolvency Professionals (IPs) or Resolution Professionals (RPs) as neutral persons for distressed entities and creditors to maximise the output value of stressed assets. IPs' discretion over billions in assets is fuelled with multiple corruption allegations. articles.summary: Observing that release on probation does not wipe out the stigma of conviction, the Supreme Court set aside the Madras High Court's decision that reduced a workman's punishment merely because he was granted the benefit of probation in criminal proceedings. “…the High Court has fell into error by observing that the conviction of the workman herein shall not be a disqualification and this conviction alone is not a ground to remove the workman from service.” , observed a bench of Justices Prashant

articles.summary: Image by: Shubha Patidar The Madhya Pradesh High Court has held that candidates participating in a recruitment process are solely responsible for regularly monitoring the official exam website for updates and instructions. The bench of Justice Jai Kumar Pillai �thus dismissed the plea of a candidate, aspiring for the post of Assistant Professor, whose candidature was cancelled due to her failure to submit the requisite documents for verification within the prescribed deadline. articles.summary: The National Green Tribunal has taken suo motu cognizance of the death of a software engineer who drowned in a waterlogged trench in Noida, observing that lapses by authorities in taking remedial measures resulted in the fatal incident and that the matter indicates violation of the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986. articles.summary: “People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to suffer violence on their behalf,” the Orissa High Court quoted George Orwell as it upheld the direction of a Single Bench, which ordered compassionate appointment as Head Constable in favour of the wife of a former Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) jawan who sustained grave injuries and disability in a bomb blast while on combat duty in 2007. After hearing Mamkootathil's counsel and the prosecution for some time , Sessions Judge N. Harikumar �posted the case on Saturday (January 24) for further hearing. articles.title: “Being Over Sensitive”: Delhi High Court Tells TV Today, Says Newslaundry's Criticism Not Necessarily Disparagement
articles.summary: The Delhi High Court on Thursday told TV Today, which owns news channels India Today and Aaj Tak, that it was being “over sensitive” of the videos made by digital platform Newslaundry by alleging that every comment made is disparagement or defamatory. A division bench comprising Justice C Hari Shankar and Justice Om Prakash Shukla said that while one of the videos impugned by TV Today was questionable, other videos were mere comments which were critical but not disparaging. articles.title: Sanction U/S 188 CrPC Not Needed To Take Cognizance Of Foreign Offence, But Mandatory Before Trial: Kerala High Court
articles.summary: The Kerala High Court has reiterated that sanction under Section 188 of CrPC is not required at the stage of taking cognizance of an offence committed outside India, while it is required for commencement of the trial. For context, section 188 of CrPC deals with the procedure, when an offence is committed outside India. articles.summary: In the challenge to the SIR across various states, the Supreme Court yesterday observed that the ECI cannot have untrammelled and unregulated powers under Section 21(3) of the Representation of the People Act, 1950, which empowers the Commission to carryout an intensive revision "in such manner as it may think fit".The Court opined that such a 'manner' has to be within the constitutional framework and principles of natural justice. articles.summary: The Jharkhand High Court has directed the Home Department to formulate guidelines to deal with persons entering Jharkhand from outside, particularly to ensure their proper identification and to require that permission be sought from the concerned police station. A Bench of Justice Sujit Narayan Prasad and Justice Arun Kumar Rai passed this direction while hearing a Habeas Corpus petition filed by a mother seeking the production of her missing daughter. A bench of CJI Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi was informed of the development by Senior Advocate Jaideep Gupta (for West Bengal government) and Attorney General R Venkataramani (for Governor). articles.summary: The Madras High Court has called for an explanation from the Director General of Police, Commissioner of Police, and Assistant Commissioner of Police as to why no action had been taken against persons who misbehaved with a court appointed administrator at the Pachaiyappa Trust. Justice G Jayachandran and Justice K Kumaresh Babu lamented that even after the matter was brought to the attention of the jurisdictional police, no action had been taken so far. articles.title: Adults Can't Use Rape Law As Tool To Criminalise Breakups In Consensual Relationships: Delhi High Court
articles.summary: The Delhi High Court has recently ruled that adults cannot use rape law as a tool to criminalize breakups when the relationship was consensual between two individuals. Justice Swarana Kanta Sharma said that failed relationships cannot be given a criminal colour, also warning against the misuse of rape charges invoked in broken romantic relationships. “An educated and independent adult, upon entering into a consensual relationship, must also recognise that the law cannot be invoked to criminalise

articles.title: 1984 Anti-Sikh Riots: Delhi Court Acquits Former Congress MP Sajjan Kumar In Janakpuri Violence Case
articles.summary: A Delhi court has acquitted former Congress MP Sajjan Kumar in case concerning allegations of inciting violence in Janakpuri and Vikaspuri areas in the national capital during the 1984 anti-Sikh riots, holding that the prosecution failed to prove his involvement beyond reasonable doubt. “ Resultantly, because of a lack of credible evidence as to the presence of the accused in the crime in question or a part of the unlawful assembly or his involvement in any manner, either through instigation, co

articles.summary: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has upheld an order of the Family Court allowing a husband's plea for DNA test of a girl child, to back his adultery allegations against the wife. articles.summary: The Supreme Court on Thursday issued notice on a curative petition filed by Lashkar-e-Taiba militant Mohd. Arif, who was sentenced to death in the 2000 Red Fort attack case. A bench of Chief Justice Surya Kant, Justice Vikram Nath and Justice JK Maheshwari issued notice on the curative petition challenging the November 2022 judgment of the Supreme Court which had affirmed the death penalty awarded to Arif and dismissed his review petition. articles.title: Supreme Court Dismisses PIL Against BCCI Representing Indian Cricket Team
articles.summary: The Court observed that the petition was frivolous and refrained from imposing exemplary costs.

articles.title: Inadvertent Error In Recruitment Notice Doesn't Create Vested Right To Appointment When No Vacancy Exists: Delhi High Court
articles.summary: The Delhi High Court has set aside an order of the Central Administrative Tribunal (CAT) which had directed the appointment of a candidate on the basis of an erroneous recruitment advertisement where no actual vacancy existed for the reserved category. A division bench of Justices Anil Kshetarpal and Amit Mahajan held that a mistake in the notification cannot create a vested right to appointment when no vacancy actually existed. articles.title: Father Who Rapes His Daughter Can't Be Shown Any Leniency In POCSO Case: Delhi High Court Upholds Conviction
articles.summary: The Delhi High Court has held that a father who rapes his daughter cannot be shown any relaxation in POCSO cases. A division bench comprising Justice Prathiba M Singh and Justice Madhu Jain upheld the conviction of a father for repeatedly raping his minor daughter studying in 6th standard in July 2021. articles.title: Order XXI Rule 102 And The Limits Of Pendente Lite Transfers In Execution
articles.summary: The law of execution often reveals the real gap between paper rights and ground reality. A decree may declare who is entitled to property, but its actual value is tested only when possession is sought. Over the years, courts have struggled to prevent decree holders from being dragged into endless litigation by persons who enter the scene only after a suit is filed. articles.summary: Holding that a bachelor earning member of a family has a moral, social and filial obligation to support his aged parents and would not spend half of his income solely on himself, the Punjab and Haryana High Court enhanced compensation awarded in a motor accident claim, reducing the deduction towards personal expenses to one-third instead of 50%. articles.title: SC Dismisses Revenue Plea as Income Tax Reassessment Was Attempted Third Time
articles.summary: The Supreme Court rejected the Revenue’s delayed appeal where reassessment was initiated repeatedly for the same year. The ruling confirms that completed reassessment on merits cannot be reopened again. The post SC Dismisses Revenue Plea as Income Tax Reassessment Was Attempted Third Time appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Quashed as Completed Assessment Had Attained Finality: Delhi HC
articles.summary: The Court held that reassessment cannot be initiated once an assessment is conclusively closed. Supreme Court directions on reassessment notices were found inapplicable to finalized cases. The post Reassessment Quashed as Completed Assessment Had Attained Finality: Delhi HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 270A Penalty Invalid for Not Specifying Applicable Limb
articles.summary: The Tribunal ruled that penalty under Section 270A cannot stand where income is enhanced purely by estimation. Additions made by applying a higher profit rate, without incriminating material, fall outside under-reporting. The post Section 270A Penalty Invalid for Not Specifying Applicable Limb appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Bogus Share Deals: Section 68 Addition Limited to 2% Commission
articles.summary: ITAT ruled that principal amounts in accommodation share entries do not constitute income of a conduit entity. Taxability is restricted to the commission earned for facilitating such transactions. The post Bogus Share Deals: Section 68 Addition Limited to 2% Commission appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: No TDS Liability on Foreign Commission as Income Not Taxable in India
articles.summary: This case addressed the allowability of commission paid to non-resident agents without TDS. The Tribunal held that since the income was not chargeable to tax in India and agents had no PE, Section 40(a)(i) could not be invoked. The post No TDS Liability on Foreign Commission as Income Not Taxable in India appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 115BBE Inapplicable After Cash Credit Deletion
articles.summary: Once the cash credit addition failed, the special tax under Section 115BBE could not survive. The Tribunal deleted the entire addition, reaffirming that consequential provisions fall with the primary addition. The post Section 115BBE Inapplicable After Cash Credit Deletion appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 11(2) Accumulation Allowed Despite Vague Form 10
articles.summary: It was ruled that failure to specify an exact project in Form 10 is a technical lapse. Where the charitable objects and utilisation are evident, accumulation cannot be disallowed. The post Section 11(2) Accumulation Allowed Despite Vague Form 10 appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Penalty Under 271AAC Fails After Section 69 Addition Deleted
articles.summary: The penalty was levied solely on the basis of an alleged unexplained investment under Section 69. Since the quantum addition was fully deleted, the Tribunal ruled that the penalty automatically collapses. The post Penalty Under 271AAC Fails After Section 69 Addition Deleted appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 271(1)(c) Penalty Invalid for Non-Specification of Charge: ITAT Agra
articles.summary: The issue was whether retaining both limbs of Section 271(1)(c) in the notice renders the penalty void. The Tribunal ruled that failure to strike off the inapplicable limb vitiates the proceedings. Penalties must be founded on precise allegations. The post Section 271(1)(c) Penalty Invalid for Non-Specification of Charge: ITAT Agra appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ITAT Mumbai Allowed Section 54F Claim in Appeal although Not Made in Return
articles.summary: It was ruled that the bar on fresh claims applies only to assessing officers, not appellate bodies. A valid Section 54F claim must be examined on merits during appeal. The post ITAT Mumbai Allowed Section 54F Claim in Appeal although Not Made in Return appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Assessment Held Void for Skipping Statutory Notice Under Section 143(2): ITAT Agra
articles.summary: This case involved reassessment completed without serving the mandatory scrutiny notice. The Tribunal ruled that such omission is not a curable defect and invalidates the proceedings. The decision reinforces strict adherence to statutory safeguards. The post Assessment Held Void for Skipping Statutory Notice Under Section 143(2): ITAT Agra appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: TDS on Stake Money Rejected Despite Section 194B Amendment
articles.summary: The issue was whether stake money paid to horse owners attracts TDS under Sections 194B or 194BB. The Tribunal held that stake money is distinct from betting winnings and deleted the Section 201 tax and interest demand. The post TDS on Stake Money Rejected Despite Section 194B Amendment appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: 12AB Denial Set Aside for Foreign Studies Grant; Funds Applied in India; Delay Condoned
articles.summary: It was ruled that funds paid in India to a student remain an application in India under Section 11. Utilisation of the grant outside India does not violate charitable exemption provisions. The post 12AB Denial Set Aside for Foreign Studies Grant; Funds Applied in India; Delay Condoned appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ITAT Agra: 20% Adhoc Expense Disallowance Deleted; Overdue Interest Remanded; 36(1)(viia) Deduction Restored
articles.summary: The case questioned whether a cooperative banks audited expenses could be disallowed on a percentage basis for alleged non-compliance. The Tribunal ruled against arbitrary disallowance without defects in accounts. The post ITAT Agra: 20% Adhoc Expense Disallowance Deleted; Overdue Interest Remanded; 36(1)(viia) Deduction Restored appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: GSTAT: Profiteering Allegation Rejected After Excess ITC Benefit Passed On
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that although profiteering was initially computed, the developer had already passed on a higher amount to the buyer. With full discharge of Section 171 obligations, proceedings were closed. The post GSTAT: Profiteering Allegation Rejected After Excess ITC Benefit Passed On appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Demonetisation 2.0: Is India Quietly Preparing for a Bigger Financial Strike?
articles.summary: Recent reforms in gold, land, and PAN tracking hint at a structured buildup toward another demonetisation. The key takeaway is a tighter, more traceable system designed to close 2016-era loopholes. The post Demonetisation 2.0: Is India Quietly Preparing for a Bigger Financial Strike? appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Why Outstanding Income Tax Demand Emails Are Reaching Taxpayers Now
articles.summary: The tax department has begun emailing taxpayers about pending demands shown on the portal. This explains why such demands exist and why the communication matters now. The post Why Outstanding Income Tax Demand Emails Are Reaching Taxpayers Now appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: GST Appellate Delays and Accruing Interest: A Constitutional Imbalance
articles.summary: GST law sets no deadline for deciding appeals, yet interest keeps accruing. Courts intervene where delay unfairly burdens compliant taxpayers. The post GST Appellate Delays and Accruing Interest: A Constitutional Imbalance appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ET Budget 2026 Survey: No easy choices for India this year as policy space shrinks dramatically in tariffs' wake

ET's pre-budget survey indicates that citizens are overwhelmingly in favour of promoting local manufacturing and increasing exports. Additionally, many are advocating for income tax cuts.

articles.title: After capacity creation, manufacturing looks to Budget 2026 for the next push
articles.summary: Union Budget: India’s manufacturing sector has moved from policy intent to capacity creation, with investment gaining pace across industries. As the Union Budget nears, stakeholders are looking for system-level reforms that improve competitiveness, remove bottlenecks and support innovation and scale in the next phase of growth.

articles.title: New year, new challenges & a retest of macro resilience set the backdrop to Budget 2026
articles.summary: Union Budget: After a volatile 2025 marked by geopolitical tensions, trade disruptions and capital flow shifts, the economy is looking to the upcoming budget to support growth, maintain fiscal discipline and shield against external shocks. While goods exports slowed and the rupee weakened amid global churn and US tariff pressures, service exports, softer crude prices, easing food inflation and policy support helped the domestic economy stay resilient.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Fiscal policy to turn pro-growth as government moves to target debt-to-GDP, economists say
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: India's fiscal policy is set to favor growth as the government shifts its focus to a debt-to-GDP ratio target from April 2026. This move is expected to lead to a gentler pace of fiscal tightening. Economists anticipate gross borrowings to reach record highs, though net borrowings may remain stable, potentially impacting bond markets.

articles.title: India Budget 2026: Resilience balance - revenue miss, deficit unchanged
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: India's fiscal health is strong, with its deficit halved post-pandemic. The upcoming Budget 2026 will assess fiscal arithmetic and outline priorities. While nominal GDP growth is slower than budgeted, a stronger FY25 base offers comfort. Revenue misses are expected due to GST rationalisation and tax relief. Higher dividends will offset this.

articles.title: Budget 2026 may be another step towards manufacturing 'atmanirbharta' for a power shift
articles.summary: India Budget Expectations: As India prepares its Union Budget 2026, the nation stands as the fastest-growing major economy amidst global uncertainty. The upcoming budget is expected to prioritize manufacturing, addressing challenges like labor reforms and infrastructure to boost the sector's contribution to GVA. Support for MSMEs facing U.S. tariff headwinds and accelerating ease of doing business initiatives are also anticipated.

articles.title: Boost for defence, infrastructure, and Nifty at 27,500 by FY27 end? Fund managers place their budget bets

articles.title: Suzlon Energy shares can gain nearly 50%, says Systematix after initiating with Buy. 4 reasons why
articles.summary: Systematix has initiated coverage on Suzlon Energy with a Buy rating and a target price of Rs 67, implying nearly 50% upside. Analysts cite Suzlon’s market leadership, stronger financials, expanding order book, and improving margins as key drivers. Robust execution and supportive industry tailwinds are expected to sustain growth through FY26–FY28.

articles.title: Billionaire Deepinder Goyal to sacrifice Rs 1,000 crore Eternal ESOPs on giving up CEO role
articles.summary: Deepinder Goyal is giving up more than ₹1,000 crore worth of unvested ESOPs as he steps down as Group CEO of Eternal, returning 3.3 crore shares to the company’s pool. Seen as a rare corporate governance move, the decision could reduce the need for near-term shareholder dilution.

articles.title: Rupee stability key market trigger as earnings hold up: Rahul Singh
articles.summary: Indian equities are seeking a decisive trigger amidst noisy global cues and improving domestic fundamentals. While earnings season has met expectations, macro concerns, particularly currency stability, are weighing on investor confidence. Valuations are normalizing, with excesses now stock-specific, and markets remain in a wait-and-watch mode.

articles.title: Union Budget FY27: Defence budget set to soar, Jefferies says betting on HAL, BEL and Data Patterns
articles.summary: Jefferies expects India’s defence budget to rise sharply in FY27, extending the indigenisation push. With strong capex momentum, rising exports and record order inflows, HAL, BEL and Data Patterns emerge as the brokerage’s top sectoral picks.

articles.title: Change but no change? What Deepinder Goyal’s resignation means for Eternal shareholders
articles.summary: Eternal's founder Deepinder Goyal is stepping down as Group CEO after 18 years. Albinder Dhindsa, Blinkit chief, will take the helm. Goyal will focus on long-term strategy, culture, and ethics. Dhindsa will manage day-to-day operations and continue leading Blinkit. This transition aims to drive Eternal's growth and societal impact.

articles.title: Anshul Saigal sees bottom-up opportunities in Indian market
articles.summary: Indian stocks show promise as valuations cool and earnings improve. Anshul Saigal of Saigal Capital sees selective opportunities for long-term investors. Macro headwinds are easing, making India attractive. PSU banks and the CDMO pharma space offer strong prospects. Metals also present an attractive outlook. Investors should focus on companies with strong cash flow and growth visibility.

articles.title: Silver prices to hit $200 in 2026? Rich Dad Poor Dad author Robert Kiyosaki makes bold prediction
articles.summary: Rich Dad Poor Dad author Robert Kiyosaki predicts silver could reach $200 per ounce by 2026, citing its historical use as money and its crucial role as a "structural metal" in modern technology. He highlighted silver's significant price appreciation since 1990, reinforcing his long-term bullish stance despite recent market retreats.

articles.title: India bonds advance on RBI buying buzz, firm US debt
articles.summary: On Thursday morning, a notable rally in Indian government bonds caught the attention of investors, largely due to speculation that the Reserve Bank of India was maneuvering in the secondary market. Coupled with a strong performance from U.S. Treasury yields, this provided an additional boost.

articles.title: Q3 Results Live: IndiGo, Adani Green Energy among key companies to announce earnings; Zee Ent's Q3 profit slips 5% YoY on weak ad demand
Fed likely to stay put through May despite rising calls for cuts
articles.summary: A majority of economists now expect the US Federal Reserve to keep interest rates unchanged through the current quarter, and possibly until Chair Jerome Powell’s term ends in May, marking a shift from earlier expectations of a near-term rate cut.

articles.title: Eternal earnings: Leadership shock may weigh on stock despite margin improvement, says Dharmesh Kant
articles.summary: Cholamandalam Securities’ Dharmesh Kant says Eternal’s stock may open lower after an unexpected leadership move, despite sequential margin improvement. PAT missed estimates, quick commerce cash burn remains high, and Blinkit’s EBITDA breakeven may be premature. He sees short-term trading opportunity, but stays cautious on long-term valuations amid intense competition from Amazon, Flipkart, and Swiggy in India markets.

articles.title: No Budget 2026 buzz as railway stocks slump up to 44% from last annual financial statement. What should investors do?
articles.summary: Railway stocks have failed to generate Budget excitement this year, with many down sharply since Budget 2025. Valuation concerns, slow execution and muted capex expectations have weighed on sentiment, prompting investors to await fresh growth triggers.

articles.title: Rs 9,000 crore wipeout! Ola shares tumble nearly 40% in 3 months. Time to buy or wait?
articles.summary: Ola Electric shares have plummeted nearly 40% in three months, wiping out Rs 9,000 crore in market value and nearing all-time lows. This sharp decline is attributed to a broader downtrend, senior management resignations, and significant stake trimming by major investors like SoftBank, despite recent market share gains.

articles.title: Angel One shares gain 3%, snap 3 day fall. What should investors do?
articles.summary: Angel One shares rebounded after a three day decline as investors bought at lower levels. Despite a year on year profit dip, sequential revenue growth, margin expansion, dividend announcement and positive brokerage commentary support near term sentiment, though volatility may persist.

articles.title: Metals outlook brightens on global cues; Trent faces near-term headwinds: Siddhartha Khemka
articles.summary: Indian metal stocks are poised for a favorable phase, driven by robust global demand for both precious and industrial metals, alongside supply constraints and supportive Indian policies. Copper, zinc, and aluminum are expected to see upside, with ferrous metals to follow, as China's demand and domestic protectionism bolster the sector.

articles.title: MyHome Group expands beyond Hyderabad, enters Mumbai, Bengaluru and Chennai with Rs 4,100 crore committed capital
articles.summary: South India's MyHome Group is making a significant nationwide push, investing ₹4,100 crore to expand into Mumbai, Bengaluru, and Chennai. This strategic move aims to leverage their proven success in Hyderabad, with new projects promising a development potential of 46.6 million sq. ft. and a GDV of ₹37,500 crore, marking a new growth phase for the 4-decade-old conglomerate.

articles.title: Prologis beats quarterly revenue estimates as warehouse demand holds firm
articles.summary: Prologis, a major real estate firm, exceeded revenue expectations in the fourth quarter. Strong demand for its storage facilities, used by retailers and manufacturers for e-commerce and inventory, boosted performance. The company, which manages vast logistics real estate globally, also expanded its data center power pipeline. Prologis expressed confidence in future earnings growth.

articles.title: Labdhi Lifestyle to invest Rs 700 cr to build office complex at BKC, Mumbai
articles.summary: Labdhi Lifestyle Ltd is investing Rs 700 crore to develop 'BKC Edge', a 2.25 lakh sq ft premium office complex in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex. The project, expected to generate over Rs 1,000 crore in sales, aims to address the acute supply constraints for Grade-A office spaces in the area. The development will feature more than 300 business suites.

articles.title: Norway sovereign wealth fund shuts Paris real estate investment office
articles.summary: Norway's sovereign wealth fund is consolidating its European real estate team in London, closing its Paris office opened in 2018. This move aims to enhance effectiveness in delivering returns, though the fund's real estate exposure in France remains unchanged. The Paris office employed six people.

articles.title: This Budget India must re-incentivise global capital or risk being ignored
articles.summary: India can no longer assume foreign capital will return on narrative alone. In USD terms, Indian equities have delivered lower returns, deeper drawdowns and weaker risk-adjusted performance than major U.S. indices. Without reducing friction, improving stability and boosting investor confidence, India risks not outflows—but global capital indifference.

articles.title: Sudip Bandyopadhyay on why profits, not just growth, will decide winners in consumer and platform stocks
articles.summary: Earnings season is here. Investors are watching new-age consumer and platform businesses closely. Eternal reported strong growth. Swiggy's results are due soon. Profitability is the key focus for food delivery and quick commerce. IndiaMART outlook is neutral. ITC Hotels looks attractive after a price drop. Operational discipline and sector tailwinds will attract investors.

articles.title: Smallcap investors look away: Over 600 stocks deliver double-digit negative returns already in 2026
articles.summary: India's smallcap market is experiencing a deep correction, with over 600 stocks seeing double-digit losses early in 2026. This downturn follows a year of consolidation, impacting midcaps and smallcaps more severely than largecaps. Investors are now prioritizing companies with strong fundamentals and predictable earnings amidst growing concerns over profitability and cash flows.

articles.title: Gold prices slip Rs 3,000 on easing Greenland concerns; silver gains Rs 7,100. What should investors do?
articles.summary: Gold prices corrected sharply after easing geopolitical tensions linked to Greenland, while silver gained. Analysts expect near term volatility and advise investors to stay cautious, avoid fresh positions and wait for clearer cues from global data and currency movements.

articles.title: High conviction picks! PL Capital selects 4 stocks with upside potential of up to 40%
articles.summary: PL Capital has identified four stocks with significant upside potential, ranging up to 40 per cent. These selections come as the Nifty faces challenges from geopolitical tensions and foreign investor outflows. The brokerage has also removed six stocks from its high conviction list.

articles.title: Shadowfax Technologies IPO Day 3: Check GMP trends, subscription updates. Should you invest?
articles.summary: Shadowfax Technologies IPO: The grey market premium has slipped to about 1% from nearly 12% just days ago. At this level, the stock is likely to list around ₹125 a share, only marginally above the IPO’s upper price band of ₹124

articles.title: Tata Communications Q3 profit jumps 55% on data, margin gains amid AI push
articles.summary: Tata Communications announced a significant 55% rise in quarterly net profit, reaching Rs 365 crore. This growth was fueled by robust performance in its data services segment and better profit margins. The company is also preparing to launch new AI-first digital infrastructure platforms. These initiatives are expected to drive future expansion and enhance customer interactions.

articles.title: Tech an enabler, future success will rely on strong base of trust: Nasscom VP on AI governance
articles.summary: Terming technology as a great enabler, Aggarwal told PTI that AI itself can be leveraged and deployed to minimise and prevent much of the harms generated by its use. Instead of regulations reacting to users' harms, there is an increasing emphasis now on setting 'technology-led guardrails', he noted.

articles.title: Urban Ladder founder launches AC startup Optimist; raises $12 million from Accel, Arkam Ventures, others
articles.summary: Founded in 2024 by Goel and Pranav Chopra, the Gurugram-based consumer brand says that it designs and manufactures air conditioners suited to India’s weather conditions. The company plans to deploy the capital towards research and development, go-to-market expansion, strengthening its retail service network, and scaling up manufacturing.

articles.title: South Korea launches landmark laws to regulate AI, startups warn of compliance burdens
articles.summary: Seoul is hoping that the new AI Basic Act will position the country as a leader in the field. It has taken effect in South Korea sooner than a comparable effort in Europe, where ‌the EU AI ‌Act is being applied in phases through 2027.

articles.title: AI has arrived in Gmail: Here's what to know
articles.summary: Google this month began rolling out a suite of new tools relying on generative AI, the technology driving chatbots, to help users manage their bloated inboxes and speed up the process of writing email. Some of the features are free, while others require paying a subscription.

articles.title: AI company Eightfold sued for helping companies secretly score job seekers
articles.summary: The lawsuit filed on Tuesday is the first in the U.S. to accuse an AI hiring company of violating the Fair ‌Credit Reporting Act, according ‌to the law firms that filed the case, and shows how consumer advocates are seeking to apply existing law to AI systems capable of drawing inferences about individuals ‌based on vast amounts of data.

articles.title: View: India is cornered by China’s lock on tech
articles.summary: India-China trade: India's industrial growth faces a new challenge as China restricts technology transfers. This impacts key sectors like electric vehicles and energy storage, affecting major Indian conglomerates. Despite recent diplomatic overtures, Beijing's stance highlights a significant technology gap. India's 'Make in India' initiative struggles against this dominance.

articles.title: No refund if you cancel late. Railways tighten rules for Vande Bharat, Amrit Bharat trains: Check new norms here
articles.summary: New ticket cancellation rules are now in effect for Vande Bharat Sleeper and Amrit Bharat II trains. Passengers cancelling confirmed tickets less than eight hours before departure will receive no refund. This change aims to reduce last-minute cancellations and improve berth utilization. These premium trains operate on a 100% confirmed berth policy, unlike regular trains.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,500 amid trade worries and foreign selling
articles.summary: Indian stock markets continued their downward trend on Tuesday, with both the Sensex and Nifty experiencing a second consecutive session of declines. Investors are closely monitoring global trade uncertainties and ongoing foreign fund outflows, while the quarterly earnings season also captures market attention. The Sensex dropped over 300 points, and the Nifty 50 fell more than 90 points.

articles.title: Union agriculture minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan addresses media on VB-G Ram G Act | LIVE
Blackstone finalises structured investment deal in AI cloud startup Neysa
articles.summary: US firm Blackstone has finalised a structured investment in Mumbai-based AI cloud startup Neysa, initially putting in $50–75 million. The deal allows Blackstone to increase its stake to a controlling position if certain business milestones are met. Neysa was was last valued at $120-130 million, and has raised $50 million in funding across two rounds till now.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the Mightiest - How understanding fiscal policy & government spending will help you make money in the stock market
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. By now we have a fair idea how the RBI, with its control over interest rates and money supply, acts as a crucial hand on the economic tiller. There is, however, another hand at work, one that operates more directly: Fiscal policy. And this is the domain of the government. And it is expressed through the Union Budget, slated for February 1. Understanding the budget is thus crucial. In this series, Macro the

articles.title: IT sector poised for better days ahead, financials to outperform: Chakri Lokapriya
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are in a wait-and-watch mode, awaiting clarity on tariffs and the Union Budget's capital expenditure focus. CIO-Equities Chakri Lokapriya highlights selective opportunities in sectors like IT, metals, and banking, while advising caution on insurance and quick commerce due to persistent competitive pressures and margin concerns.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the mightiest - Part 8: How to read the yield curve, and use it to gain an edge in the markets
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. Now, investors are constantly searching for a reliable crystal ball that accurately predicts the future. While no indicator is perfect, one has come closer than any other: The yield curve. A specific, peculiar behaviour of the yield curve, known as an inversion, has preceded most major economic recessions in the US. When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts
articles.summary: Had it not been for the hit taken by the ITC stock, the Nifty and Sensex would have ended much higher on the first trading day of 2026. Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: RBI’s dollar sales cross FY25 levels, hit $43.2 billion as rupee stays volatile
articles.summary: While spot market sales slowed in November, RBI’s forward market positions stayed elevated. The central bank had sold $66 billion in forwards by the end of the month.

articles.title: Zee Entertainment shares rise despite margin pressure in Q3
articles.summary: Net profit for the quarter declined 5.1% year-on-year to ₹155.3 crore from ₹163.6 crore. Revenue rose 15.2% to ₹2,280 crore, compared with ₹1,979 crore in the year-ago period.

articles.title: Ujjivan Small Finance Bank Q3 Results: Stock jumps after 71% profit growth, better asset quality
articles.summary: Ujjivan Small Finance Bank in its investor presentation, also stated that credit costs will trend lower as the secured book expands and the steady-state credit cost is seen in the range of 1% to 1.5% of average gross loan book.

articles.title: Groww Mutual Fund launches Nifty PSE ETF
articles.summary: Groww Mutual Fund launches Groww Nifty PSE ETF to track Nifty PSE Index. NFO runs from January 22 to February 5. Managed by Nikhil Satam, Aakash Chauhan and Shashi Kumar.

articles.title: Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC Q3 results: Net profit rises 20%, revenue up 7%
articles.summary: Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC posted a 20% profit rise in Q3 to ₹269.4 crore, with revenue at ₹478 crore and QAAUM up 20% year-on-year.

articles.title: Motilal Oswal MF launches Financial Services Fund; NFO to open on Jan 27
articles.summary: Motilal Oswal Mutual Fund launches Motilal Oswal Financial Services Fund, an open-ended equity scheme focused on financial sector firms, managed by Ajay Khandelwal and team.

articles.title: Uttar Pradesh: Making a mark as future-ready investment hub at WEF 2026
articles.summary: At the World Economic Forum 2026 in Davos, Uttar Pradesh secured MoUs worth ₹9,750 crore, led by waste-to-energy, AI-ready data centres and defence manufacturing, signalling strong investor confidence.

articles.title: Manipur: Meitei man shot dead after abduction in violence-hit Churachandpur
articles.summary: Media reports revealed that the deceased, Mayanglambam Rishikanta Singh, was abducted along with his Kuki wife, Chingnu Haokip, from their home in Tuibong on Wednesday

articles.title: Why Bernstein is sticking to Eternal’s ₹370 target despite leadership reshuffle
articles.summary: October–December quarter 2025 (Q3FY26) results and Blinkit’s profitability underpin Bernstein’s outlook on Zomato, even as leadership changes weigh on near-term sentiment, according to Jignanshu Gor, Director & Senior Research Analyst at Bernstein.

articles.title: Radico Khaitan Q3 Results: Stock jumps after 20% revenue growth, margin expansion
articles.summary: In previous interactions with CNBC-TV18, the management of Radico Khaitan has highlighted that they have received some tailwinds from commodity prices and margin improvement will sustain at over 150 basis points this year.

articles.title: Eating too much preservatives may raise cancer and diabetes risk: Study
articles.summary: While most preservatives appeared safe, the research found that high intake of a few was linked to higher cancer risk.

articles.title: Maharashtra will drive our next phase of growth, says Jindal Stainless CEO
articles.summary: Jindal Stainless expects to maintain its FY26 volume growth guidance of 9–10% and close EBITDA per tonne near the upper end of its ₹19,000–21,000 per tonne range, according to company management. The firm said export uncertainty in Europe and the US has weighed on shipments, while domestic demand remains the priority. It has spent about ₹2,200 crore of its planned ₹2,700 crore capex and reduced net debt to ₹3,451 crore. The company is working on a large greenfield project in Maharashtra and said

articles.title: Why yellow food is central to Basant Panchami celebrations
articles.summary: The tradition of eating yellow food on Basant Panchami is rooted in seasonal nutrition, digestion, immunity, and mental clarity rather than ritual alone.

articles.title: RailTel bags AMC order from Ministry of Defence, strengthens order book
articles.summary: RailTel Corporation of India Ltd won a ₹140.71 crore AMC order from Ministry of Defence, adding to recent PFMS and Ahidms contracts. Completion is set for January 30, 2031.

articles.title: Canara HSBC Life looks to outpace industry as protection demand picks up
articles.summary: Anuj Mathur, MD & CEO of Canara HSBC Life Insurance, said the company has sharpened its focus on protection, with protection riders being offered alongside ULIPs and seeing strong customer uptake, while the overall protection business—including credit life and individual protection plans—is expected to grow well over the next three months, lifting the protection mix from about 4% earlier to nearly 7% now.

articles.title: Bank of India sees margins bottoming out in March quarter
articles.summary: Rajneesh Karnatak, MD & CEO, Bank of India said the bank’s current loan mix comprises about 58% retail, agriculture and MSME (RAM) advances and 38% corporate loans. Over the long term, the bank aims to increase the share of the RAM book to around 65% while bringing down the corporate portfolio to about 35%, as this mix is expected to deliver better margins going ahead.

articles.title: Tata Communications sticks to FY28 goal to turn digital portfolio profitable
articles.summary: AS Lakshminarayanan, MD & CEO of Tata Communications outlines the company’s push into artificial intelligence-led services and Software as a service (SaaS) offerings, even as it targets 2027-28 (FY28) for digital portfolio profitability.

articles.title: APL Apollo Tubes shares rise 4% after record Q3 volumes and profit
articles.summary: APL Apollo Tubes posted its highest-ever quarterly sales volume, EBITDA and profit during the quarter.

articles.title: WEF 2026: Andhra Pradesh brings its technology-led growth vision to Davos
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh at WEF 2026: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu leads efforts to attract global investment in AI, green energy, and Quantum Valley innovation.

articles.title: Merely calling hypertension lifestyle disorder not enough to deny disability pension: Delhi HC
articles.summary: The Delhi High Court has held that merely describing primary hypertension as a lifestyle disorder is not enough to deny disability pension to a retired Indian Air Force (IAF) officer.

articles.title: TTK Healthcare shares fall 3% after Q3 profit drops 34%
articles.summary: Revenue saw a modest increase of 2.2% to ₹209 crore from ₹205 crore, pointing to subdued topline growth during the quarter.

articles.title: Indian Bank Q3 Results: Stock gains over 5% after slippages improve, double-digit business growth
articles.summary: In absolute terms, Indian Bank's Gross NPA declined to ₹14,268 crore from ₹16,134 crore, while Net NPA stood at ₹967 crore from ₹983 crore in the September quarter.

articles.title: Mumbai to have woman mayor from general category
articles.summary: Mumbai will get a woman mayor from the general category after the reservation lottery for 29 metropolitan municipalities in Maharashtra was held at Mantralaya.

articles.title: Three killed, one wounded in Australia shooting; police say shooter at large
articles.summary: Three people were shot dead and another injured in Lake Cargelligo, New South Wales, after reports of gunfire on Thursday. Australia Police say the shooter remains at large and have urged residents to stay indoors.

articles.title: Razorpay POS gets RBI approval for offline payment aggregator licence
articles.summary: Razorpay POS got RBI's Payment Aggregator Physical licence, allowing authorised in-store payments and boosting its regulatory position.

articles.title: AI trade is still keeping global investors away from India, says HSBC strategist
articles.summary: HSBC’s Herald Van Der Linde said foreign investors continue to favour Taiwan and South Korea due to strong AI-driven earnings growth, leaving India temporarily out of focus. While India’s valuations and earnings outlook have improved slightly, concerns over currency and competition remain. He also said central bank demand supports gold prices and highlighted banks, autos and jewellery stocks as preferred sectors in India.

articles.title: Air India braces for record $1.6 billion loss after deadly crash
articles.summary: The losses come on the back of a turbulent year for Indian aviation marked by flier anxiety, flight delays and mass cancellations by a rival carrier that has put a spotlight on the duopolistic market structure.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs raises 2026 gold target by 10% to $5,400 per ounce
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs raises gold forecast to $5,400 per ounce for end-2026, citing strong private-sector and central bank buying, with ETFs set to rise as US Federal Reserve rate cuts are expected.

articles.title: KEI Industries unfazed by new entrants, sticks to 20% growth plan
articles.summary: Anil Gupta, Chairman and Managing Director of KEI Industries, said export growth is being supported by the company’s aggressive expansion into new countries, addition of geographies and products, and steady increase in technical approvals across global markets. He added that this momentum is expected to continue, with exports likely to grow by around 35–40% in the next financial year as the company scales up its international presence.

articles.title: Supreme Court allows Hindu prayers at disputed Bhojshala site on Basant Panchami
articles.summary: Supreme Court allows Hindu prayers from sunrise to sunset and Muslim namaz from 1 pm to 3 pm at Bhojshala-Kamal Maula Mosque in Dhar on Basant Panchami, urging mutual respect and law and order.

articles.title: SC refuses to issue omnibus directions on stampede prevention
articles.summary: During the hearing, the bench asked, “Can we issue such directions at all?” and expressed reservations about the feasibility of court-mandated, all-encompassing guidelines for crowd control

articles.title: Axis MF launches BSE India Sector Leaders Index Fund; NFO to open on Jan 23
articles.summary: Axis Mutual Fund launches Axis BSE India Sector Leaders Index Fund, managed by Karthik Kumar, tracking top companies in 21 sectors. NFO runs January 23 to February 6.

articles.title: Noida techie death: Fresh FIR against builders for flouting environment pollution laws
articles.summary: The FIR has been lodged even as a Special Investigation Team (SIT) formed by the Uttar Pradesh government on Thursday continued its probe into the matter on the third day.

articles.title: United States set to quit World Health Organization
articles.summary: The WHO also said that the US has not yet paid the fees it owes for 2024 and 2025. Member states are set to discuss the US departure and how it will be handled at the WHO’s executive board in February.

articles.title: Hindustan Zinc, Hindustan Copper shares slide as silver prices fall and ETFs tumble
articles.summary: The sell-off in silver ETFs comes amid a sharp build-up in leveraged positions over recent weeks.

articles.title: Want an international trip on a budget? Eight cheapest countries to visit from India
articles.summary: For Indian travellers, 2026 is shaping up as a year where several overseas destinations offer solid value - helped by competitive travel and manageable daily costs. Data from Skyscanner shows that flight prices to some regions have softened, bringing both nearby and long-haul destinations into consideration. Here are some of the cheapest international destinations Indian travellers can look to travel to this year.

articles.title: What should Budget 2026 focus on, a new survey
articles.summary: The Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI) conducted a survey of 100 companies to list out the industry's expectation from India's annual budget to be tabled in the Parliament on Feb 1.

articles.title: Dipan Mehta on when to buy midcaps and sectors where value is emerging
articles.summary: Dipan Mehta, Director of Elixir Equities said Sky Gold and Diamonds offers exposure to the jewellery sector through its B2B model. As a key supplier to major jewellery chains, the company stands out for its strong growth prospects and reasonable valuations, making it a stock to watch.

articles.title: Globalisation no longer guides US policy, India must rethink strategy: Meera Shankar
articles.summary: Donald Trump’s Davos address underscored a decisive shift in US economic thinking, with protectionism, energy nationalism and transactional diplomacy taking precedence over global integration. Indian policy experts say the message for New Delhi is clear: recalibrate trade and strategic priorities in a world where US domestic politics increasingly shape global outcomes.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Trump to Moneycontrol: 'We’re going to have a good deal with India'
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump’s upbeat comments at the World Economic Forum have renewed focus on negotiations between New Delhi and Washington, with both sides seeking to resolve trade frictions and expand cooperation across manufacturing, technology and strategic sectors.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Trump's tariffs aren't crashing global growth—Gita Gopinath explains why
articles.summary: Gita Gopinath explains why the real economic impact of US tariffs has been far smaller than feared, as AI-led investment, strong equity markets and expansionary fiscal policy across major economies continue to support growth despite rising trade uncertainty.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Trump hails ‘economic miracle’, says US growth outpacing global forecasts
articles.summary: Donald Trump told Davos the US economy is booming under his policies, claiming inflation is beaten, investment is surging and America is powering global growth.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Jewellers' body recommends GST rationalisation and MSME support
articles.summary: The GJC has submitted pre-Budget recommendations to the Centre, seeking GST rationalisation, MSME relief and measures to boost formalisation.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Industry leaders pin hopes on retail, green energy, AI, and digital assets

Davos: Swiss firms’ interest in India surges after EFTA trade deal
articles.summary: A wave of Swiss business enthusiasm is sweeping towards India, following the recent Trade and Economic Partnership Agreement with the European Free Trade Association. The number of investment inquiries and advisory support requests has skyrocketed, more than doubling in frequency.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Ashwini Vaishnaw flags India’s growth strength, export resilience amid global tariff turmoil
articles.summary: India is set to become the world's third-largest economy. This growth is driven by infrastructure investment, inclusive development, manufacturing, and simplified laws. The nation is also building resilience against global trade shocks. India is emerging as a key player in AI and semiconductors. These advancements position India for sustained long-term growth.

articles.title: India to keep growing 6-8% in real terms in next 5 years: Ashwini Vaishnaw at Davos
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow robustly by 6-8% in real terms over the next five years, according to Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. He highlighted significant improvements in telecom tower installation times, reducing them from 270 days to just 7. Discussions at the World Economic Forum also emphasized the need to boost per-capita income and diversify trade relationships.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Global interest grows in India’s approach to AI, says Vaishnaw
articles.summary: India's focus on making technology accessible and scalable is drawing global attention at the World Economic Forum in Davos. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw highlighted India's approach to using AI and digital platforms for broad-based growth. Global leaders are recognizing India's progress in semiconductors and AI. States are also leveraging Davos for collaborations and attracting investment, showcasing cooperative federalism.

articles.title: Davos WEF 2026: Adani Group sets out Rs 6 lakh cr investment blueprint for India
articles.summary: The Adani Group has unveiled a Rs 6 lakh crore investment plan across aviation, clean energy, and digital infrastructure, focusing on integrated, technology-led platforms. The blueprint, presented at Davos, spans Maharashtra, Assam, and Jharkhand, aiming to boost employment and align with India's growth priorities like energy transition and manufacturing self-reliance.

articles.title: “Mother of all trade deals” with India coming soon: EU’s Ursula von der Leyen at WEF
WEF Davos: CFI, Bharti show interest in setting up data centres in Karnataka
articles.summary: Global companies are eyeing Karnataka for significant investments. CFI Technologies and Bharti Enterprises plan new data centres. Carlsberg Group confirms a Rs 350-crore bottling unit. Bharat Forge explores manufacturing opportunities. Mistral AI intends to build a Global Capability Centre. Philip Morris International seeks to manufacture smoke-free products. Imperial College London considers an R D centre.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Smriti Irani calls for collective action on maternal health, pollution and urban planning
articles.summary: At Davos, Smriti Irani highlighted global maternal health issues, India’s innovation, pollution’s cost, and called for joint action from all sectors.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Global capital is shifting from China to India, says Kedaara Capital's Manish Kejriwal
articles.summary: Manish Kejriwal at Davos 2026 highlights India’s rise as a top investment hub amid global shifts, with valuations and currency trends shaping deals and IPOs driven by strong domestic participation.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | JPMorgan’s Filippo Gori sees positive global mood, strong India flows and robust M&A pipeline
articles.summary: Geopolitics, inflation and AI expected to shape investment decisions in 2026, says

articles.title: Davos 2026: Theme, who is attending, India's presence and more — All you need to know
articles.summary: The World Economic Forum is claiming record levels of government participation, with 400 top political leaders expected to take part, alongside nearly 850 of the world's top CEOs. The top political leaders include 65 heads of state and government and six of the G7's leaders.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Bain & Company's Manny Maceda says CEOs must rethink playbooks for a fragmented world order
articles.summary: Manny Maceda of Bain & Company says CEOs must adapt to fragmented global markets, AI-driven transformation, and India’s rise as a key growth hub for technology, consumer, and financial sectors.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Uber sees India as key market for mobility and technology innovation
articles.summary: Andrew Macdonald, President & COO of Uber, said India remains a highly competitive market where the focus is on sustainable growth. He added that new players and low-cost innovations keep competition intense, but Uber is holding its ground, with learnings from India helping shape its operations across 75 global markets.

articles.title: WEF 2026: Electrification and automation will stay key growth drivers, says ABB CEO
articles.summary: ABB CEO Morten Wierod said India is currently the company’s fourth-largest market globally, but the target is to move it to the third position before 2030. He added that the internal mandate to the team is to achieve this milestone earlier than planned, reflecting ABB’s strong commitment and confidence in the Indian market.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Welspun group is expanding in energy sector with $500 million investment, says BK Goenka
articles.summary: Overall, the multinational conglomerate Welspun Group is expanding in the energy sector with an investment of over $500 million, with $100 million investment in Saudi Arabia and $400 million in the US. Read on:

articles.title: WEF 2026: Satellite firm ICEYE and robotics startup Skild AI outline growth plans and funding outlook
articles.summary: At Davos 2026, satellite firm ICEYE and robotics startup Skild AI said rising defence budgets and labour shortages are driving demand for their technologies. ICEYE has signed a €1.4 billion contract with Germany for a new satellite constellation, while Skild AI has raised over $1.4 billion to build software that acts as a “brain” for robots. Both founders said investor interest in deep tech has increased and India could play a role in future robotics manufacturing and supply chains.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | GST cuts, cricket sponsorship drive tyre demand in India; Europe remains a tightrope for Apollo Tyres
articles.summary: Apollo Tyres is leaning on strong domestic demand, improved consumer spending and brand-led rural expansion to drive growth in India in 2026, even as weak volumes, rising Chinese competition and margin pressures keep its European business in a tight spot, prompting cost cuts and manufacturing realignment.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Saint-Gobain to accelerate capex, acquisitions in India; positions country as key export hub
articles.summary: Saint-Gobain plans to significantly scale up investments and acquisitions in India while transforming the country into a regional export hub for building materials, as strong infrastructure demand and manufacturing capabilities make India central to the group’s global growth strategy.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Investments in India's AI infra may cross $150 billion in 2026
articles.summary: India got a commitment of $70 billion investment from Google, Microsoft, and Amazon in the last 12 months. The next 12 months could see nearly as much in fresh commitments, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told CNBC-TV18.

articles.title: WEF 2026 | Cognizant bullish on 2026 as US demand rebounds, AI and outcome-based deals fuel growth
articles.summary: Jatin Dalal, Chief Financial Officer of Cognizant, said the company is preparing for its next phase of growth by doubling down on artificial intelligence, outcome-based contracts and selective mergers and acquisitions.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Novartis CEO Vas Narasimhan sees AI payoff for pharma in 7–10 years
articles.summary: Novartis CEO Vas Narasimhan touts AI innovation, cost goals, and neuroscience investment to speed medicine delivery and expand access in India.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Uber to tap logisitcs, digital commerce business in India, says President Macdonald
articles.summary: In a conversation with CNBC-TV18’s Shereen Bhan, the Uber chief revealed that the company now hopes to tap into “adjacent services,” including package delivery and retail fulfillment, through its driver network.

articles.title: You’re 'not addicted' to screen: What is Doomscrolling and why it feels impossible to stop?
articles.summary: Late-night scrolling through distressing news, known as doomscrolling, is a stress response, not a lack of discipline. Our brains, wired for survival, interpret constant negative information as a threat, leading to anxiety and sleep issues. Understanding this helps shift focus from self-blame to managing stress and practicing digital hygiene for peace

articles.title: World must show zero tolerance for terror, EAM tells Spain counterpart
articles.summary: India and Spain have pledged to strengthen international cooperation against terrorism, with External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar emphasizing a "zero tolerance" approach. The two nations reviewed bilateral ties, including trade, defense, and culture, and discussed regional developments. Spain also acceded to India's Indo-Pacific Oceans Initiative.

articles.title: EWS flat 'fraud': SC notices to Haryana govt, builder
articles.summary: The Supreme Court has summoned responses from the Haryana government and Mahira Buildwell concerning allegations of cheating homebuyers in an affordable housing project under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana. Homebuyers claim the developer used fraudulent means, including forged bank guarantees, and has completed minimal construction, siphoning off funds.

articles.title: ‘Nobody rescued yet’: Several feared missing in landslip at New Zealand campsite; minister calls it ‘war-zone’
articles.summary: A devastating landslide at a New Zealand campsite has left several people missing. Emergency crews are searching through debris after the slip swept through campervans and tents. Difficult conditions and unstable ground are hampering rescue efforts as authorities work to account for everyone.

articles.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang urges nations to treat AI as core national infrastructure
articles.summary: Speaking to BlackRock CEO Laurence Fink at a World Economic Forum session, Huang emphasised that AI has become as essential to national development as traditional utilities like electricity and transport networks. He stated that the technology represents a fundamental shift in how countries manage their natural resources of language and culture.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Geoeconomic tensions top business risk for 2026, says WEF's Saadia Zahidi
articles.summary: The World Economic Forum’s Global Risks Report says geoeconomic confrontation is the top risk for 2026 and the next two years. Business leaders are worried about tariffs, investment controls, access to critical resources, and supply chains. Geopolitical and state-based conflicts are the next major concerns, according to WEF Managing Director Saadia Zahidi.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Deal conversion key to unlocking AI revenue: Wipro's Rishad Premji
articles.summary: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji highlights AI scaling as the key challenge, with deal conversion delays impacting growth, but expects revenue upside as order bookings rise and AI platforms expand.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Power, security, and enterprise readiness to define next phase of AI adoption in 2026, say tech CEOs
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence shifts from experimentation to large-scale deployment, technology leaders at Davos warn that energy constraints, cyber security risks, and the need for enterprise-grade decision systems will determine how fast and how safely AI can be adopted in 2026.

articles.title: Explainer: Why RBI wants to link BRICS digital-currencies
articles.summary: Digital tokens such as stablecoins have been a tectonic shift for global finance, allowing for the movement of money across borders at a fraction of the cost and time of traditional banking.

articles.summary: The Madras High Court has appointed retired high court judge to supervise the allotment of shops at the Marina beach in an attempt to reduce the number of hawkers at the beach. The court has also appointed Retired Principal District Judge & former judicial member of NCLT T Mohan

articles.title: Minor Valuation Gap Not Enough for Capital Gains Addition
articles.summary: ITAT held that when the same property valuation has been accepted in co-owners’ cases, a contrary view cannot be taken for another co-owner. Consistency in tax treatment is mandatory. The post Minor Valuation Gap Not Enough for Capital Gains Addition appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 68 Addition Set Aside as Onus of Proof Was Discharged
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that once the assessee proves identity, genuineness, and source through documents and bank records, the burden shifts to the Revenue. Without rebuttal of evidence, addition under Section 68 cannot survive. The post Section 68 Addition Set Aside as Onus of Proof Was Discharged appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 263 Upheld for Freight TDS Lapse in Reassessment Case
articles.summary: ITAT ruled that the AO’s omission to apply TDS provisions on freight charges warrants revision. Proper application of statutory disallowances is mandatory in reassessment proceedings. The post Section 263 Upheld for Freight TDS Lapse in Reassessment Case appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: GST Compliance Burden Persists Due to Procedural Gaps & Portal Design: ICAI
articles.summary: The document identifies how discretionary powers, rigid procedures, and GST portal limitations undermine Ease of Doing Business. It calls for system-driven reforms to reduce litigation, duplication, and cash-flow blockages. The post GST Compliance Burden Persists Due to Procedural Gaps   Portal Design: ICAI appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Unpublished Notification Invalid; MIP Applies Only from Gazette Publication Date: SC
articles.summary: The Supreme Court held that a trade restriction cannot bind importers unless published in the Official Gazette. Website uploads or internal circulation do not give a notification legal effect. The post Unpublished Notification Invalid; MIP Applies Only from Gazette Publication Date: SC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: DRP assessment quashed as time-barred – Section 153 overrides Section 144C timelines
articles.summary: The issue was whether DRP cases escape the outer limitation under section 153. The Tribunal held that section 153 continues to apply and quashed the assessment as time-barred. The post DRP assessment quashed as time-barred   Section 153 overrides Section 144C timelines appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Assessment Quashed as U/s 143(2) Issued by Wrong Jurisdictional AO
articles.summary: The issue was whether an assessment is valid when notice under Section 143(2) is issued by an officer lacking pecuniary jurisdiction. The Tribunal held such notice invalid and quashed the assessment as void ab initio. The post Assessment Quashed as U/s 143(2) Issued by Wrong Jurisdictional AO appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ITAT Ahmedabad: CIT(A) Order Vitiated for Mixing Two Years’ Facts; Remanded
articles.summary: It was ruled that deciding appeals based on facts of another year is a serious legal error. The matter was sent back for reconsideration on correct facts. The post ITAT Ahmedabad: CIT(A) Order Vitiated for Mixing Two Years’ Facts; Remanded appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 68 Addition Quashed as Cash Source Was Fully Traceable: ITAT Agra
articles.summary: This case involved a ₹1 crore cash deposit treated as unexplained by tax authorities. The Tribunal ruled that since the deposit was sourced from earlier withdrawals, the addition was unsustainable. The post Section 68 Addition Quashed as Cash Source Was Fully Traceable: ITAT Agra appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Partner Capital & Loan Sec 68 Additions Quashed; Identity/Creditworthiness/Genuineness Proved
articles.summary: It was held that documented capital contributions supported by affidavits, bank records, and land evidence are explained credits. Assessing authorities cannot disregard undisputed financial capacity. The post Partner Capital   Loan Sec 68 Additions Quashed; Identity/Creditworthiness/Genuineness Proved appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Unsecured Loan Addition Set Aside Due to Rule 46A Lapse
articles.summary: The appellate order confirmed loan additions without addressing the Rule 46A plea. Holding this to be a serious procedural defect, the Tribunal set aside the order for de novo adjudication. The post Unsecured Loan Addition Set Aside Due to Rule 46A Lapse appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ITAT Agra Upholds Separate NP Rates: 0.22% (Animal Trading) & 8.7% (Scrap)
articles.summary: The dispute centered on profit estimation after reopening for suppressed turnover. The Tribunal affirmed lower NP for animal sales, recognising industry norms and assessee history. The ruling underscores tailoring estimates to trade economics. The post ITAT Agra Upholds Separate NP Rates: 0.22% (Animal Trading)   8.7% (Scrap) appeared first on TaxGuru .
