articles.title: Mint Explainer: What RBI’s unified foreign exchange rules mean for India’s service exporters
articles.summary: The change matters because services now account for a growing share of India’s exports, yet remain underrepresented in the formal reporting architecture under Fema

articles.title: SBI Research says India to be world’s third largest economy by 2028, upper middle-class income country by 2030 — Details
articles.summary: India is projected to become an upper-middle income country by 2030 and the third largest economy by 2028, according to an SBI Research report. Here's a look at the projections, how achievable they are, and the likely challenges. nbsp;

articles.title: Decades-long reforms: How India's discoms returned to profits but have  ₹7 trn of cumulative debt to deal with
articles.summary: India's power distribution sector returned to profit in FY25, reporting ₹2,701 crore net profit after years of losses. The overhang of a cumulative debt over ₹7 trillion still remains, but reforms and improved operational indicators contributed to this revival.

articles.title: Economic activity pickup to help India record all time high toll collection of Rs1 trillion in FY27
articles.summary: While Icra analysts suggest the ₹1 trillion mark is more likely in the ‘medium term’, government officials expect the operationalization of 12,000 km of new highways and the MLFF system to fast-track this milestone.

articles.summary: The multilateral agency also upgraded its estimate of global economic growth for calendar years 2025 and 2026, but warned that over-optimism about AI, alongside rising trade and geopolitical tensions, could trigger a sharp market crash and disrupt the global economy.

articles.title: 3,000! Number of billionaires surged to record levels in 2025, collective wealth at $18.3 trillion: Oxfam
articles.summary: The level of billionaire wealth is now higher than any time in history, the study noted. It further said that since 2020, the jump in billionaires' wealth was recorded at 81%.

articles.title: UPI credit lines may get card-like interest-free windows
articles.summary: The NPCI is pinning its hopes on clearer regulations and credit card-like features to drive adoption of UPI-linked credit lines.

articles.title: Build-operate-transfer model returns: India to bid out half its highways, worth Rs75,000cr, next fiscal
articles.summary: Armed with an investor-friendly concession agreement, the Centre plans to bid out half of the national highway projects in fiscal 2027. This will total 5,000 km worth ₹75,000 crore under the build-operate-transfer (BoT) toll model—a bidding structure that was popular 10-20 years ago.

articles.title: Indian industry confidence hits five-quarter high on demand, reform optimism: CII survey
articles.summary: Business confidence rose for a third straight quarter in October–December, lifted by resilient domestic demand, reform expectations and capex optimism, even as global uncertainty weighs on growth.

articles.title: Budget may allocate  ₹28,000 crore to food processing schemes to aid farmers
articles.summary: The Centre is considering a ₹28,000 crore allocation for food processing schemes PMFME and PMKSY to improve farmers' incomes and reduce post-harvest losses. The plan includes enhancing credit-linked subsidies and modern infrastructure to support farm growth and job creation.

articles.title: The week in charts: Mixed IT earnings, rising inflation, climate crisis
articles.summary: In this weekly Plain Facts compilation, we present to you data-based insights, with easy-to-read charts, to help you delve deeper into the stories reported by Mint in the week gone by.

articles.title: Govt scales back MSME interest support under Niryat Protsahan scheme
articles.summary: Under the revised rules, interest subvention will now apply only to the interest cost actually borne by the exporter, and not to any broader credit cost element, a change that significantly limits the scope of support and removes interpretational leeway for banks and exporters.

articles.title: India's forex reserves jump $392 million to $687.19 billion, RBI data reveals
articles.summary: India's forex reserves increased by $392 million to $687.19 billion as of 9 January 2026, according to Reserve Bank of India data. The previous week saw a decrease of $9.809 billion, bringing reserves to $686.80 billion.

articles.title: IMF to upgrade India outlook in January, calls it as ‘key growth engine for global economy’
articles.summary: India continues to remain a key growth engine for the global economy, with its economic performance staying strong and resilient, International Monetary Fund spokesperson Julie Kozack said. nbsp;

articles.title: ‘Paint Mumbra green’ remark by AIMIM’s youngest corporator triggers political controversy. Who is she?

articles.summary: UK approves a ‘mega’ Chinese Embassy in London, despite criticism of security risks

articles.summary: A timeline of how the US and Europe have been at odds

articles.summary: Instead of buying more Mirages outright in early 2000s, the requirement was tweaked in favour of a medium-weight, multi-role fighter with Mirage-like performance.

articles.title: CISF to take over security of all sea ports; govt approves airport-like hybrid arrangements
articles.summary: Development comes in the backdrop of Amit Shah chairing meeting to set up a dedicated body for the security of vessels and port facilities. It will be called Bureau of Port Security.

articles.title: Army hunts for 2 JeM terrorists who killed a soldier, injured 8 others in J&K’s Kishtwar
articles.summary: Nearly 35 Pakistani terrorists are believed to be hiding in the dense forests of the mountainous Doda and Kishtwar districts in the Chenab Valley region.

articles.title: Finding jobs for Agniveers: CISF forms committee to assess ways to induct them into force
articles.summary: CISF DG Praveer Ranjan said committee will identify sectors where Agniveers can be deployed, and will soon come out with a blueprint to ensure smooth induction.

articles.title: Paras Defence bets on advanced chip packaging with new semiconductor arm
articles.summary: The group is also building an OSAT facility. This is in view of a larger plan to create a hub for chiplet integration and advanced system-in-package technologies.

articles.title: India calls on families of staff at missions in Bangladesh to return ahead of 12 Feb polls
articles.summary: The latest advisory comes as anti-India sentiment continues to soar in Bangladesh. The first polls of the post-Sheikh Hasina era are scheduled for 12 February.

articles.title: China’s Bangladesh envoy visits Teesta for technical assessment close to ‘Chicken’s Neck’
articles.summary: Bangladesh water resources adviser Syeda Rizwana Hasan told local reporters that Beijing was keen to implement Teesta Master Plan as soon as possible.

articles.title: Polish Deputy PM Sikorski likens India’s Pakistani terror concerns to Russian aggression in Ukraine
articles.summary: Talks between EAM Jaishankar and Polish counterpart continued about an hour past scheduled time, indicating depth of the conversation. Polish Deputy PM also met NSA Ajit Doval.

articles.title: Selective targeting of India ‘unfair, unjustified’: Jaishankar flags US & EU sanctions on Russian oil
articles.summary: Jaishankar makes it clear in meeting with Poland's Radosław Sikorski that India’s issue was not just with US tariffs, but also actions taken by EU to curb purchases of Russian oil.

articles.title: 4-yr-old boy ‘locked in dark room, tortured’. Delhi kindergarten horror in French embassy premises
articles.summary: Probe into cruelty allegations against school's directors   staff comes after several weeks of child's mother filing a police complaint, that too only after child rights authorities stepped in.

articles.title: India, Japan wrap up 18th Strategic Dialogue. Talks focus on critical minerals, UNICORN radar
articles.summary: For Japan, diversification of supply chains is important given its rising tensions with Beijing. For India and Japan, focus on ensuring US engagement in the region, says Japanese spokesperson.

articles.title: EU-India FTA set to be inked on 27 January after years of negotiations. Here’s why it’s important
articles.summary: The European Union is India’s single-largest trading partner when exports and imports with all 27 member-states are calculated. The deal has been almost two decades in the making.

articles.title: Project Rise: How Dawoodi Bohras are tackling malnutrition crisis in Maharashtra’s tribal belt
articles.summary: In collaboration with govt   non-profit, project aims to build trust, improve nutrition. It has shown measurable success in Nandurbar district, now under implementation in Chandrapur.

articles.title: Kapiva Launches INR 50 Cr Fund To Back Ayurveda Research
articles.summary: D2C ayurveda brand Kapiva has launched a INR 50 Cr innovation fund to support research and product development in Ayurveda.

articles.title: Apple Pay Eyes India Launch By 2026-End
articles.summary: iPhone maker Apple is reportedly mulling launching its digital payments service, Apple Pay, in India by late-2026. As per a

articles.title: Amid Gig Worker Debate, Zepto’s Aadit Palicha Meets Labour Minister
articles.summary: Quick commerce startup Zepto’s CEO and cofounder Aadit Palicha met Union labour minister Mansukh Mandaviya amid the ongoing debate around

articles.title: [Update] Shadowfax IPO: Issue Subscribed 60% On Day 2
articles.summary: Updated   January 21, 18:54 IST Logistics major Shadowfax s IPO closed the second day of bidding with 60% subscription, getting

articles.title: Why VCs Are Rethinking Their Healthtech Bets
articles.summary: The Indian healthtech sector is in its transition phase, with VCs rethinking their bets. In the Covid era, the likes

articles.title: Govt To Infuse INR 5K Cr Into SIDBI To Foster MSME Growth
articles.summary: The union government has approved equity support of INR 5,000 Cr into Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) to

articles.title: How Flent Is Trying To Clean Up India’s Urban Rental Mess
articles.summary: A social media listing for rented apartments, promising no involvement of a broker, often turns out to be a hoax

articles.summary: Update   January 21, 18:05 IST Shares of Amagi recovered after a muted listing and ended the first trading session

articles.title: MakeMyTrip Q3: Profit Falls 73% YoY To $7.3 Mn On Higher Finance Costs
articles.summary: Nasdaq-listed online travel aggregator (OTA) MakeMyTrip (MMT) reported a 73% decline in its net profit to $7.3 Mn for the

articles.title: Eternal Q3: Blinkit, Hyperpure Achieve Adjusted EBITDA Profitability
articles.summary: Eternal’s quick commerce arm Blinkit and B2B business Hyperpure achieved adjusted EBITDA profitability in Q3 FY26. Blinkit posted an adjusted

articles.title: Eternal Q3: PAT Jumps 73% YoY To INR 102 Cr
articles.summary: Zomato-parent Eternal’s consolidated net profit jumped 73% to INR 102 Cr in the quarter ended December 31, 2025 (Q3 FY26)

articles.title: Deepinder Goyal Steps Down As Eternal Group CEO
articles.summary: Deepinder Goyal is stepping down from the role of Group CEO of Eternal. February 1, 2026 would be his last

articles.title: Enerzolve Nets $5.1 Mn To Build Infrastructure For Intelligent Energy Systems
articles.summary: Bengaluru-based deeptech startup Enerzolve Smart Technologies has raised $5.1 Mn (about INR 46.7 Cr) in its seed round co-led by

articles.title: Arkahub Secures $2 Mn To Scale Residential Solar Power Solutions
articles.summary: Rooftop solar solutions provider Arkahub has secured $2 Mn (INR 18.3 Cr) in a seed funding round led by Kae

articles.title: IndiGo crisis: Turbulence to absurdity
articles.summary: A farcical outcome to an unprecedented collapse reduces India’s aviation ecosystem into a new theatre of the absurd

articles.title: Elon Musk's X restricts ability to create explicit images with Grok
articles.summary: The move comes amid global outrage over explicit, AI-generated images that have flooded X. In the last week, regulators around the world have opened investigations into Grok, and some countries have banned the application.

articles.title: Court rules TikTok can continue to operate in Canada for now
articles.summary: In November 2024, ‌Canada's industry ‌ministry ordered TikTok's business to be dissolved, citing national security risks, but added ‌the government was not blocking access or users' ability to create content.

articles.title: PSU banks counting on QR-based payments to breach a fintech fort
articles.summary: Public sector banks are entering QR-code merchant payments, challenging fintechs like Paytm and PhonePe. These lenders are not only trying to build servicing channels for these merchants, they are also looking to build merchant-focused applications, soundboxes and QR code-led acquisition strategies.

articles.title: PE-backed digital engineering services firms turn to M&A deals in search for scale
articles.summary: With a receptive market for IPOs and a significant expansion of the market for digital engineering services—beyond traditional software development to encompass cloud-native product engineering, software modernisation and embedded AI solutions, among others—PE-led firms are using inorganic growth routes to propel their growth and cash in on faster exit opportunities.

articles.title: Bharti eyes Karnataka data centre; Sify set to inaugurate new facility
articles.summary: Bharti Enterprises has expressed interest in setting up a data centre in Karnataka, industries minister M B Patil said on Wednesday. Patil made the announcement while attending the world economic forum in Davos.

articles.title: We don’t give investment advice, says Sudha Murty, urging people to stay vigilant against cyber crime
articles.summary: In a post on X, Murty said, “I want to alert you to fake videos circulating online that falsely use my image and voice to promote financial schemes and investments. These are deepfakes created without my knowledge or consent. Please do not make any financial decisions based on these fraudulent videos. "

articles.title: Pocket FM taps former Meta scientist Vasu Sharma as head of AI
articles.summary: Pocket FM has appointed Vasu Sharma, a former scientist at Meta’s Facebook AI Research (FAIR), as its head of artificial intelligence (AI). Sharma, who will report to cofounder Prateek Dixit, will lead AI research and innovation across narrative generation, production intelligence and large-scale localisation.

articles.title: Ryanair CEO dismisses Elon Musk's idea of buying the airline as verbal feud escalates
articles.summary: The CEO of Ryanair on Wednesday dismissed Elon Musk's idea of buying the budget airline and shrugged off insults from the billionaire, in a war of words that erupted over installing Starlink systems on aircraft. O'Leary said last week that the airline had ruled out putting Musk's Starlink satellite Wi-Fi on Ryanair planes because the extra fuel drag from the system's antennas would be too costly.

articles.title: Nvidia boss sees 'trillions' in AI spending ahead
articles.summary: The infrastructure to develop and power generative artificial intelligence models will require further "trillions" of dollars in investment, the head of top AI chipmaker Nvidia said Wednesday.

articles.title: US-based Blaize signs MoU with Telangana govt to support AI initiatives
articles.summary: Blaize signed an MoU with the Telangana government to support initiatives in electronics, semiconductors, and AI. The partnership will explore industry use-cases for AI solutions in healthcare diagnostics, manufacturing automation, and energy efficiency. The company has raised over $330 million from global investors including Mercedes-Benz and Samsung.

articles.title: Blinkit turns Ebitda positive in Q3FY26
articles.summary: Quick commerce platform Blinkit turned adjusted EBITDA positive for the first time in Q3 FY26, posting a Rs 4 crore profit compared with a Rs 103 crore loss a year earlier. This comes just as Deepinder Goyal stepped down as Eternal CEO, with Albinder Dhindsa appointed his successor.

articles.title: Amagi’s muted listing cuts valuation 41% to $821 million
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs made a muted stock market debut, with its market capitalisation falling over 41% from its last private valuation. The SaaS company raised Rs 1,789 crore through its IPO, which was subscribed 30 times despite global market concerns. Early backers and founders of Amagi Media Labs saw a modest dip in paper gains following the listing.

articles.title: As Eternal names a new CEO, a look back at Zomato’s journey
articles.summary: Eternal — the parent company of Zomato and Blinkit — announced in a stock exchange filing on Wednesday that its founder Deepinder Goyal has resigned from his position as CEO. The company has named Blinkit founder and CEO Albinder Dhindsa Goyal’s successor, effective February 1.

articles.title: Intel results to spotlight turnaround efforts as AI data centers boost chip demand
articles.summary: Intel shareholders are optimistic about the company's results like they have not been for many quarters, betting the turnaround CEO ‍Lip-Bu Tan promised was taking root and that ​rapid data center build outs were fueling strong demand for its traditional server chips.

articles.title: Meta's new AI team delivered first key models internally this month, CTO says
articles.summary: At a press briefing on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum's ‌annual meeting ‌in Davos, CTO Andrew Bosworth said the models built by its Meta Superintelligence Labs team, formed last year, showed a ‌lot of promise.

articles.title: This is a change in title, not in commitment: Deepinder Goyal on stepping down as Eternal CEO
articles.summary: In a letter to shareholders, Goyal said this decision comes from his desire to pursue "significantly higher-risk exploration and experimentation" that falls outside the strategic scope of a listed entity.

articles.title: What next for Deepinder Goyal? A look at his ventures beyond the Eternal universe
articles.summary: Outside the Eternal universe, which consists of food delivery platform Zomato, quick commerce app Blinkit, going-out business District, and business-to-business supplies firm Hyperpure, Goyal has founded and invested in other sectors.

articles.title: Deepinder Goyal steps down as Eternal CEO: Read his full letter to shareholders
articles.summary: Deepinder Goyal announced on Wednesday that he is stepping down as the group CEO of Eternal, transitioning to the role of vice chairman on the board of directors, subject to shareholder approval. Albinder Dhindsa, CEO of Blinkit, has been named the new group CEO.

articles.title: Deepinder Goyal resigns as Eternal CEO; company names Albinder Dhindsa as successor
articles.summary: The company has named Blinkit founder and CEO Albinder Dhindsa as Goyal's successor, effective February 1. Goyal will step into the vice-chairman role and will remain on Eternal’s board of directors. "Of late, I have found myself drawn to a set of new ideas that involve significantly higher risk exploration and experimentation. These are the kinds of ideas that are better pursued outside a public company like Eternal," Goyal said in a letter to shareholders.

articles.title: Hurun India launches ‘Uth’ series for under 40 leaders with Avendus
articles.summary: First-generation founders account for 349 entrants, or nearly 80% of the list, while 37 entrants are second-generation leaders, the strongest cohort among family-business successors, according to the report.

articles.title: Philippines to restore access to Grok after developer commits to safety fixes
articles.summary: The move ⁠to block came as governments and regulators from Europe to Asia cracked down on sexually explicit content generated by Grok on the social media platform X, launching probes, imposing bans and demanding safeguards.

articles.title: OpenAI rolls out age prediction on ChatGPT
articles.summary: OpenAI's ‌CEO of applications, Fidji Simo, had in December said that she expects "adult mode" to debut within ChatGPT in the first quarter of 2026, following chief executive Sam Altman's comments about allowing mature content for users ‍who verify their age.

articles.title: FTC says it will appeal Meta antitrust decision
articles.summary: The FTC said it continues to allege that, for more than a decade, Meta Platforms Inc. has "illegally maintained a monopoly" in social networking through anticompetitive conduct "by buying the significant competitive threats it identified in Instagram and WhatsApp."

articles.title: Hospitals, insurers rejig operations as DPDP kicks in next year
articles.summary: India’s healthcare and health insurance sectors are ramping up data protection as the DPDP Act comes into force in May 2027. Hospitals and insurers are embedding privacy into operations, updating policies, and investing in compliance tools. The legislation is seen as both a regulatory mandate and an opportunity to build long-term trust in the space.

articles.title: Regulatory clarity key for crypto adoption: Binance co-CEO Richard Teng
articles.summary: Binance co-CEO Richard Teng says clearer crypto regulations are needed for wider adoption in India, even as the US leads the sector. He views crypto as complementary to UPI and sees AI and blockchain as mutually reinforcing technologies. Teng also explained why enthusiasm around central bank digital currencies is dying globally.

articles.title: Tier-II GCC dream awaits govt bridge to cross execution gap
articles.summary: Despite budget promise, government has not formalised national framework; global firms stay cautious over talent depth and fragmented rules.

articles.title: Netflix intensifies bid for Warner Bros making its $72 billion offer all cash
articles.summary: Netflix is now offering to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studio and streaming business in all cash - in an effort to win over the Hollywood giant's shareholders for its $72 billion merger and potentially thwart a hostile bid from Skydance-owned Paramount.

articles.title: Digital payments firm PhonePe gets Sebi approval for $1.5-billion IPO
articles.summary: PhonePe has received Sebi approval for its $1.5 billion IPO, which could value the Walmart-backed fintech at around $15 billion. The company, a market leader in UPI payments, has expanded into credit, insurance, and stockbroking. Last year, it narrowed losses and grew revenue 40%, highlighting strong financial momentum.

articles.title: Taiwan's Inventec says decision on Nvidia's H200 chip 'appears to be stuck' on China's side
articles.summary: The U.S. formally approved the chip for export to China last week ‌with some ‌conditions. Reuters reported last week that Chinese customs authorities told customs agents that the ‌H200 chip was not permitted to enter China though it was not clear whether this constituted a formal ban or a temporary measure.

articles.title: PhonePe gets Sebi nod for IPO; Microsoft, Walmart to pare stake in OFS
articles.summary: Walmart-backed PhonePe has secured Sebi approval for its IPO, clearing a major hurdle for one of India’s biggest fintech listings. The $14.5-billion startup plans a $1.5-billion OFS, with Walmart, Tiger Global, and Microsoft set to sell shares. Strong payments dominance and rising revenues underpin investor confidence.

articles.title: Why this PE guru says India could be No. 1 in your lifetime
articles.summary: David Rubenstein of The Carlyle Group predicts India could become the world's largest economy within 20-30 years, citing its young, growing population as a key advantage over aging nations. While India's economy is already the fourth largest, sustained growth and strategic reforms are crucial to capitalize on this demographic dividend and achieve global economic dominance.

articles.title: India likely to grow 6.5-7% in FY27 amid global risks: ET-PwC survey
articles.summary: As per the survey, 78% of respondents expect India's growth to remain in the 6.5-7% band in FY27, reflecting optimism arising out of the current growth momentum, which the majority of CXOs described as strong to stable, while 21% expect it to be between 6% and 6.5%, and only 1% of the respondents foresee it in the 7-7.5% range.

articles.title: New labour codes weigh on BFSI sector's earnings
articles.summary: New labour laws in India have increased costs for banks, NBFCs, and insurance firms. Companies adjusted staff benefits to comply with these reforms. HDFC Bank reported an expense impact of about Rs 800 crore. Other lenders like ICICI Bank and Yes Bank also saw significant impacts.

articles.title: India to remain fastest-growing major economy despite global tensions: RBI
articles.summary: India's economy is poised for strong growth, projected to be the world's fastest. Domestic demand is robust, and the manufacturing and services sectors are performing well. Despite global geopolitical risks and US trade tariffs, Indian exporters are diversifying.

articles.title: A guide to PMAY-Urban 2.0: Affordable housing for urban India
articles.summary: Dream of owning a home? Discover PMAY-Urban 2.0 benefits, including interest subsidies and financial aid for urban housing. Check your eligibility and apply today!

articles.title: Tariffs be damned: Global CEOs are still betting on India
articles.summary: Global CEOs see India as a top investment spot for 2026. Strong economic growth, a large consumer base, and stable policies are key attractions. India's economy is expanding rapidly, outpacing many nations. Reforms in taxation and labor laws further boost confidence. This makes India a resilient and attractive destination for international capital amid global slowdowns.

articles.title: India fertiliser imports on track to hit all-time high of $18 billion this fiscal year
articles.summary: India's fertilizer imports are set for a record surge this fiscal year. Officials predict a 76% jump to $18 billion. This increase is fueled by farmers expanding crop areas after heavy rains. Consumption of key fertilizers like urea and DAP is rising significantly. This trend reflects ample monsoon rainfall encouraging winter crop planting across the nation.

articles.title: Budget 2026: The next phase of India’s growth depends on resolving a critical imbalance
articles.summary: India Budget 2026 Expectations: As Budget 2026 approaches, urban India's middle class is holding back on discretionary spending, impacting economic value chains. While rural demand has recovered, urban consumption remains fragile due to persistent inflation in essentials and EMI burdens. Policy measures focusing on tax relief and reducing system friction are crucial to revive urban spending without compromising fiscal discipline.

articles.title: Budget 2026–27: Government plans double-digit hike in rural scheme allocations to boost growth, demand
articles.summary: The government is planning double-digit increases in allocations for key rural schemes in Budget 2026–27 to boost growth and demand, with higher spending likely on rural jobs, housing and roads.

articles.title: Tax structure for MNCs with India biz may be reworked
articles.summary: India is considering revamping its permanent establishment tax framework, including formula-based profit attribution, to protect taxing rights, offer clarity to MNCs and digital firms, and reduce long-running tax disputes.

articles.title: Road map in works for $100 billion textile and apparel exports by 2030
articles.summary: India plans to significantly boost textile exports to $100 billion by 2030. The strategy involves increasing shipments to Free Trade Agreement partners and focusing on premium products like handlooms and silk. New districts will be developed to join the export ecosystem. This initiative aims to expand India's global market share in textiles.

articles.title: India FTA to create market of 2 billion people: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen
articles.summary: The European Union is on the brink of a landmark trade agreement with India, potentially linking a consumer base of two billion individuals. In a bid to strengthen these negotiations, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen is scheduled to visit India shortly. This strategic move reflects the EU's goal of broadening its global trade horizons and fostering international collaboration.

articles.title: RMZ, Andhra Pradesh Govt ink strategic pact to enable up to $10 billion in investments
articles.summary: RMZ commits $10 billion to Andhra Pradesh for mixed-use, digital, industrial, and logistics infrastructure over five to six years. Plans include a 10 million sq ft IT park and a 1 GW data centre in Visakhapatnam, plus a 1,000-acre industrial park in Rayalaseema, aiming to boost employment and technology-led growth.

articles.title: Reduce customs duty slabs in Budget 2026: GTRI
articles.summary: India's customs duty structure needs simplification. The Global Trade Research Initiative suggests reducing the actual number of duty slabs, not just basic customs duty rates. This reform aims to boost ease of doing business. Current complexities hinder manufacturing and exports. Simplifying tariffs and processes is crucial for economic growth and competitiveness.

articles.title: India’s core sectors' growth accelerates to 4-month high of 3.7% in December
articles.summary: India's eight core infrastructure sectors grew by 3.7% in December 2025, a slowdown from the previous year but an acceleration from November's 2.1% expansion. This growth, driven by coal, fertilisers, steel, cement, and electricity, signals a positive trend for industrial momentum as these sectors hold significant weight in the Index of Industrial Production.

articles.title: India-Europe ‘mother of all deals’ within reach as EU chief Ursula von der Leyen hints at breakthrough
articles.summary: In a move that could redefine trade relationships, India and the European Union are finalising a groundbreaking free trade agreement. EU dignitaries Ursula von der Leyen and Charles Michel are set to be the esteemed Chief Guests at India's Republic Day celebration.

articles.title: Govt to extend quality certification fee concessions for small firms by 3 years
articles.summary: Quality certification fee concessions for small and medium enterprises will be extended by three years. This move supports India's manufacturing sector. The Bureau of Indian Standards is facilitating this extension. Micro units will receive an 80 percent fee reduction. Small enterprises get a 50 percent reduction. Medium-sized firms will benefit from a 20 percent concession.

articles.title: Ignore gold's message at your peril
articles.summary: Gold emerged as a top performer in 2025, a year marked by significant global financial market turmoil. This surge in gold's value is linked to political instability and economic uncertainty. Central banks worldwide increased their gold purchases, seeking protection. The article highlights gold's historical role as a hedge against inflation and currency depreciation during turbulent times.

articles.title: India's sugar output jumps 22% to 15.9 million tonnes by mid January: ISMA
articles.summary: India's sugar production has seen a significant jump of 22 percent by mid-January in the 2025-26 season. Higher cane supplies and improved yields are supporting this growth. Mills are operating at a higher capacity. However, falling sugar prices are impacting mill finances and farmer payments.

articles.title: FICCI's Manufacturing Index reaches all-time high in Q3 FY26
articles.summary: India's manufacturing sector shows sustained growth and optimism, with 91% reporting higher or same production levels in Q3 FY 2025-26. Domestic demand is also strong, with 86% anticipating increased orders. Despite capacity utilization near 75%, global and operational challenges are noted, though export expectations remain positive.

articles.title: Japan's Nikkei snaps five-day losing streak as JGBs extend gains
articles.summary: Japan's Nikkei ‍share average rose on Thursday, ​snapping a five-day skid, as a rally in domestic ⁠bonds and de-escalating tensions between the United States and Europe supported demand for risk assets.

articles.title: We’re not perfect, open to inputs from government: Zepto’s Palicha after meeting labour minister Mandaviya
articles.summary: After meeting Union labour and employment minister Mansukh Mandaviya, the Zepto cofounder said the quick commerce company supports government initiatives and is open to constructive suggestions. Additionally, Palicha said Zepto has created employment for more than 180,000 delivery partners and over 40,000 store personnel, truck drivers and warehouse operators, adding that rivals such as Eternal-owned Blinkit, Swiggy, Rapido and Urban Company, among others, have also played a key role in supporti

articles.title: Deepinder Goyal goes beyond Eternal; PSU banks enter QR battle
articles.summary: Happy Thursday! Deepinder Goyal steps down as Eternal CEO, with Albinder Dhindsa set to take over. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Disptach.

articles.title: Forrester picks holes in IT’s AI story, says just 10-15% pilots scale
articles.summary: Despite the brouhaha, most artificial intelligence projects in Indian IT services firms are failing to deliver sustained results. Research firm Forrester says only 10-15% of AI projects make it into long-term production use, though companies claim rapid adoption across their operations.

articles.title: Travel accessories platform Escape Plan raises $25 million from Jungle Ventures, others
articles.summary: Escape Plan has raised $25 million in a funding round led by Jungle Ventures, with participation from Fireside Ventures and IndiGo Ventures, the venture capital (VC) arm of IndiGo Airlines. The latest round comes six months after the company raised $5 million in a funding round led by Jungle Ventures and Fireside Ventures.

articles.title: D2C brand Kapiva launches Rs 50 crore fund to support R&D in Ayurveda
articles.summary: Healthcare brand Kapiva launched a Rs 50 crore innovation fund to support research and product development in Ayurveda. The fund will back projects from academia, startups, and labs, with grants ranging from Rs 50 lakh to Rs 6 crore. Kapiva will also provide mentoring, infrastructure, and expand its Bengaluru R D facilities to aid applicants.

articles.title: Energy startup Enerzolve raises $5.1 million led by Jungle Ventures, Kae Capital
articles.summary: Deeptech energy startup Enerzolve Smart Technologies raised $5.1 million in a funding round led by Jungle Ventures and Kae Capital, with several angel investors participating. The company plans to use the capital to deepen its core intellectual property across silicon, firmware, and power electronics, expand engineering and product teams, and set up pilot manufacturing and certification for key product lines.

articles.title: Deepinder Goyal looks beyond Eternal
articles.summary: Deepinder Goyal is stepping down as CEO of Eternal, which he cofounded 18 years ago. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Solar platform Aerem raises $15 million from Sumitomo Mitsui’s venture arm, others
articles.summary: Aerem Solutions has raised $15 million (Rs 136 crore) in a round led by the SMBC Asia Rising Fund, the venture capital (VC) arm of Japan’s Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation. Existing investors including British International Investment (BII), UTEC, Blume Ventures, Avaana Capital, Riverwalk Holdings, and SE Ventures also participated in the round.

articles.title: Blue Machines AI sets new benchmark by engaging in unscripted hour-long debate on national TV
articles.summary: In a groundbreaking national television debut, Indian AI platform Blue Machines AI successfully engaged in a 60-minute unscripted news debate. This historic man-versus-machine contest showcased the AI's ability to handle complex discussions, interruptions, and rapid topic shifts, demonstrating enterprise-grade reliability and governance for India's burgeoning tech sector.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt
articles.summary: A prominent Hindu deity statue inauguration in Texas sparks protests and political backlash. This incident highlights growing anti-Indian sentiment in America. Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

articles.title: Thangamayil Jewellery to add more stores around Chennai from FY27
articles.summary: Thangamayil Jewellery Ltd expects to cross ₹7,500 crore in revenue in FY26, driven by higher gold, silver and diamond volumes and continued momentum in the fourth quarter, according to SM Lakshmanan, VP-Finance & Accounts of the company. He said most of its gold inventory is hedged, while silver hedging may be increased from current levels. It also reported an improvement in EBITDA margin to 6.27% for the first nine months, supported by higher non-gold sales and expansion of its Chennai store ne

articles.title: Odisha bans gutkha, pan masala and all tobacco-nicotine products
articles.summary: The ban covers gutkha, pan masala, zarda, khaini, and any other food items containing tobacco or nicotine.

articles.title: India to sift through urban waste for critical minerals, may tweak e-waste rules
articles.summary: Mines Secretary Piyush Goyal expects India to become a regional recycling hub for critical minerals, with new schemes and private sector partnerships boosting recovery and value chain development.

articles.title: Rupee could slide to 92.5-93 per dollar if pressure persists: ANZ’s Dhiraj Nim
articles.summary: Dhiraj Nim, Economist and FX Strategist at ANZ Research, attributed the rupee’s weakness to two key pressures: continued outflows from Indian markets amid visible stress from the ongoing earnings season and global risk jitters.

articles.title: Bihar govt awards ₹100-crore Aadhar enrolment centres project to BLS
articles.summary: The Bihar government on Tuesday awarded a project worth Rs 100 crore to an AI and techenabled company for establishing Permanent Enrollment Centres (PEC) for Aadhaar, a company official said.

articles.title: What India Inc wants from Budget 2026: Cost relief, faster execution, policy clarity
articles.summary: Ahead of Budget 2026, leaders like Nirmala Sitharaman, Aparna Reddy, Abhimanyu Munjal and Prashant Mathur urge targeted fiscal support, faster execution and cost rationalisation for growth.

articles.title: India’s core sector growth hits four-month high in December, led by cement and steel
articles.summary: Eight core industries grew 3.7% in December, up from 2.1% in November, with cement and steel output rising sharply. Crude oil and natural gas production continued to decline.

articles.title: Andhra Pradesh is open for business: ‘Just one whatsapp message away’, says Nara Lokesh at WEF
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh IT and HRD Minister Nara Lokesh said that "good news" around investments across 22 various clusters ranging from aqua, cement, renewable energy, and quantum, among other sectors can be expected in the next 90 days. Read on:

articles.title: Budget 2026 needs to be more than Aatmanirbhar
articles.summary: In a world where leverage beats values-based alliances, strategic autonomy is a necessity both for economic growth and diplomatic success. Therefore, the next budget must be anchored in foreign policy as much as local economic needs.

articles.title: FMCG demand stabilises after GST reset, but recovery remains uneven
articles.summary: Industry data shows FMCG growth has sustained in recent months but is now driven mainly by volumes after the GST reset and lower prices. Value growth remains softer, while competition among online and offline retail channels is increasing.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Axis Bank CEO flags deposit stress amid faster credit growth, seeks RBI liquidity push
articles.summary: Axis Bank CEO Amitabh Chaudhry warned of intense competition for deposits, urged stronger RBI liquidity support, and said credit and deposit growth cannot diverge, speaking at Davos.

articles.title: After historic profit, government moves to strengthen discoms
articles.summary: After historic profit, the Centre forms a GoM to strengthen discom finances, address state liabilities, and continue reforms that have cut losses and improved efficiency.

articles.title: Global growth to hold steady at 3.3% in 2026, says IMF; India seen growing at 6.4% in FY27
articles.summary: India’s growth outlook remains one of the strongest, with expansion projected at 6.4% in both FY27 and FY28, after an upward revision to 7.3% for FY26 on the back of a stronger-than-expected outturn. India's growth projections are 6.3% for 2026 and 6.5% for 2027 based on calendar year, the IMF said in its report.

articles.title: Explainer: Understanding market borrowing and fiscal deficit, the numbers that move markets on Budget day
articles.summary: On Budget day, markets focus on gross borrowing and fiscal deficit figures, as these impact bond yields, RBI actions, and equity valuations in banks, NBFCs, real estate and infrastructure.

articles.title: DPIIT likely to ease FDI norms for existing defence license holders
articles.summary: According to CNBC-TV18 sources, the government is considering increasing the FDI limit for defence companies with existing licences from 49% to 74% under the automatic route.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Industries look for predictability, investment push, and targeted support
articles.summary: Industry leaders want Budget 2026 to focus on growth, reforms, fiscal stability, inclusion, and boost manufacturing, fintech, healthcare, and smaller cities.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal: India-EU FTA will be the ‘mother of all deals’; No EU member opposes
articles.summary: India and European Union may finalise a Free Trade Agreement by 27th January, with support from all 27 EU states. Talks cover CBAM, GI, critical minerals, and aim for balanced trade growth.

articles.title: ‘Nothing is grandfathered’: Supreme Court’s Tiger Global ruling puts pre-2017 Mauritius investments at risk
articles.summary: Tax experts warn verdict may embolden authorities to reopen PE, VC and FPI deals, raising fresh uncertainty for foreign investors

articles.title: Sebi proposes to allow 'netting of funds' for FPIs in cash market to trim funding cost
articles.summary: Under the current framework, an FPI needs to settle equity cash market trades on a gross basis, funding each purchase transaction independently of any sale transactions, even on the same day.

articles.title: SEBI Chairman dismisses FPI exit fears, says outflows cyclical; registration, netting reforms coming soon
articles.summary: SEBI Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey said recent foreign portfolio investor outflows are cyclical and modest relative to the scale of overseas investments in India, while outlining upcoming reforms to speed up FPI registration, ease KYC frictions and introduce netting to improve market efficiency.

articles.title: SEBI chair drops hints on key market reforms coming soon
articles.summary: SEBI Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey signalled a series of changes aimed at making Indian markets more efficient and accessible. From easing processes for foreign investors to tweaks in trading systems, several reforms could be closer than expected.

articles.title: Unemployment rate rises marginally to 4.8% in December 2025
articles.summary: The overall Unemployment rate is estimated at 4.8% in December 2025 against 4.75% observed in November, according to the Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS).

articles.title: Lemonade slashes Tesla full self-driving insurance rates by 50%
articles.summary: Lemonade launches Autonomous Car insurance for Tesla with Full Self-Driving, cutting rates by 50% when FSD is active. Rollout starts in Arizona and Oregon, leveraging Tesla data for pricing.

articles.title: NITI Aayog suggests setting up of national agency to implement green transition for MSMEs
articles.summary: NITI Aayog recommends a national project management agency for MSMEs’ green energy transition, aiming for net zero by 2070, with sector-specific roadmaps for cement and aluminium industries.

articles.title: Senco Gold acquires 68% stake in August Jewellery for ₹68 crore
articles.summary: Senco Gold Ltd's board approved a ₹68 crore investment to acquire 68% stake in August Jewellery Private Limited (AJPL), owner of the Melorra brand. AJPL, incorporated in 2015, operates 21 stores across India and specialises in fast-fashion lightweight jewellery. The acquisition aims to strengthen Senco’s digital and omnichannel strategy, create synergies, and enhance innovation and customer experience.

articles.title: Nestle India gets relief as Supreme Court dismisses tax appeals involving ₹101 crore
articles.summary: Supreme Court dismisses income tax department’s appeals against Nestlé India over disallowance of general licensing fees for FY1996–98, 1999–2001, and 2004–08. The matter, involving ₹101.21 crore, had earlier been decided in favour of the company by the Delhi High Court. No settlements or impacts on key management; litigation now closed.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Wipro's AI-led turnaround faces bumps despite strong deal wins—Rishad Premji explains why
articles.summary: Rishad Premji says order bookings and large deals offer comfort, but client ramp-up delays and cost pressures continue to weigh on near-term growth.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Honeywell doubles down on automation, data and physical AI, says CEO
articles.summary: Honeywell is reshaping its strategy around automation, data and physical AI, with CEO Vimal Kapur highlighting productivity gains, cautious capital allocation and limited tariff impact at Davos 2026.

articles.title: Waaree Energies Q3: Net profit, revenue, margins post healthy sequential growth
articles.summary: Waaree Energies Q3 net profit rose 26% to ₹1,062 crore, revenue up 24.7% over the previous quarter. Shares of Waaree Energies ended lower on Wednesday, January 21, by 2.82% at 2,435.70.

articles.title: PNB Housing Finance Q3 Results: Net profit up 11% on strong retail disbursements, stable asset quality
articles.summary: PNB Housing Finance reported a 10.6% year-on-year increase in Q3 net profit to ₹521 crore, supported by a 12.8% rise in net interest income to ₹757 crore. Growth was driven by steady expansion in the retail loan book, which rose 16% year-on-year to ₹81,931 crore and now accounts for nearly the entire loan portfolio, while the corporate book continued to shrink sharply.

articles.title: ICICI Prudential Smallcap Fund reopens for subscriptions from January 23, 2026
articles.summary: ICICI Prudential Smallcap Fund will reopen for subscriptions from January 23, 2026, with all PAN-level investment restrictions withdrawn, allowing lump sum, switch-ins, SIP, and STP transactions, while all other scheme provisions remain unchanged.

articles.title: KEI Industries Q3: Profit jumps 43%, margins expand; interim dividend declared
articles.summary: KEI Industries posted 42.5% profit growth at ₹234.8 crore in Q3FY26, driven by its core cables and wires segment. Board declared ₹4.50 interim dividend and approved delisting from Calcutta Stock Exchange.

articles.title: State Bank of India Q3 results to be declared on February 7
articles.summary: State Bank of India will announce Q3FY26 results on February 7, 2026, in Mumbai, with an analyst meet at State Bank Bhavan Auditorium. Trading window reopens 48 hours after results.

articles.title: This founder is set to become CEO of the company that acquired his startup
articles.summary: Albinder Dhindsa, Founder of Grofers and CEO of Blinkit, is set to become Group CEO of Eternal Ltd, succeeding Deepinder Goyal, after leading Blinkit to rapid growth and profitability.

articles.title: Govt approves equity support of ₹5,000 cr to SIDBI
articles.summary: The government approved ₹5,000 crore equity support for SIDBI, aiming to boost MSME credit, add 25.74 lakh new beneficiaries, and generate 1.12 crore jobs by 2027-28.

articles.title: CESC's green arm to invest ₹3,800 crore in Uttar Pradesh solar plant
articles.summary: CESC Green Power Ltd signed an MoU with the Uttar Pradesh government to set up a 3GW solar cell and module plant, a 60 MW solar power plant, R D facilities, and ancillary units, at an investment of around ₹3,800 crore; this comes on the heels of a ₹4,500-cr project in Odisha.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Automation is a secular growth story; Honeywell bets on Forge and physical AI to drive productivity
articles.summary: Honeywell sees long-term growth in industrial automation as companies seek higher efficiency across energy, supply chains and buildings, with its Forge platform and sector-specific use of AI expected to support steady revenue and earnings expansion even as the company moves towards a three-way corporate split by 2026.

articles.title: HPCL Q3 Results: Net profit up by 6%; misses Street estimates
articles.summary: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd posted Q3 FY26 net profit of ₹4,072.5 crore, missing estimates. Revenue rose to ₹1.15 lakh crore. Visakh and Mumbai refineries operated near full capacity.

articles.title: Dr Reddy’s Q3 Results: Profit beats estimates on higher revenue, despite YoY decline
articles.summary: Dr Reddy’s Laboratories reported Q3 net profit of ₹1,209 crore, beating estimates, while revenue and EBITDA also came in above expectations; though on a year-on-year basis, profit and EBITDA declined and margins contracted sharply, a 4.4% rise in revenue notwithstanding.

articles.title: 436 Under-40 entrepreneurs, $950 billion in business: Inside Hurun’s Uth Series
articles.summary: Avendus Wealth and Hurun India list 436 under-40 entrepreneurs like Nikhil Kamath, Ritesh Agarwal, Ghazal Alagh, shaping India’s economy with a net worth over $950 billion.

articles.title: Fintech firm ZET receives NPCI approval to launch UPI payments on RuPay credit cards
articles.summary: ZET gains NPCI approval as TPAP, launches ZET UPI for RuPay credit card-linked UPI payments, powered by Juspay and RBL Bank, offering cashback and credit-building for first-time borrowers.

articles.title: Why Deepinder Goyal left Eternal CEO role to work on extending human lifespan, aircraft startup
articles.summary: Deepinder Goyal has stepped aside as Group CEO at Eternal to focus on high-risk ventures spanning longevity research, brain-health wearables and hybrid-electric aircraft, pursued outside the listed company.

articles.title: Bank of India Q3 Results: Net profit up 8% on higher NII and better asset quality
articles.summary: Bank of India reported a 7.5% year-on-year rise in Q3 net profit to ₹2,705 crore, supported by a 6.5% increase in net interest income to ₹6,462.6 crore, while asset quality improved sequentially with gross NPA declining to 2.26% and net NPA easing to 0.60%.

articles.title: Deepinder Goyal steps down as Eternal CEO; Blinkit chief Albinder Dhindsa to take over
articles.summary: Eternal founder Deepinder Goyal has stepped down as Group CEO, with Blinkit head Albinder Dhindsa set to take charge, subject to shareholder approval, as Goyal continues on the board as Vice Chairman.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh sees AI-led growth opportunities outweighing headwinds
articles.summary: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh at Davos said AI is driving growth, with over 90 percent top clients engaged in AI projects. Financial services and energy sectors show improving demand.

articles.title: How AI is reshaping India’s pharma and healthcare playbook
articles.summary: AI is expected to shift from pilots to scale in Indian pharma by 2026, with BCG noting that early adoption is already accelerating drug discovery and delivering measurable outcomes.

articles.title: JPMorgan UK unit to open branch in Gujarat's GIFT City
articles.summary: JPMorgan had set up a unit in Gift City in 2024 to develop derivative products, while the US bank’s Indian unit opened a branch in the hub in 2022. The latest move will allow JPMorgan to trade financial instruments for clients based outside India.

articles.title: L'Oreal to set up first global Tech Hub in Hyderabad with ₹3,500 crore investment
articles.summary: L’Oréal’s Global Tech Hub in Hyderabad, India, is the first Beauty Tech hub of its kind.

articles.title: Sony Cedes Control of Bravia TVs to China’s TCL Electronics
articles.summary: Sony Group Corp. will sell a 51% stake in its home entertainment arm, including Bravia TVs, to TCL Electronics Holdings Ltd., forming a joint venture starting April 2027.

articles.title: BCCI bags ₹270 crore AI sponsorship deal for IPL
articles.summary: BCCI secures a ₹270 crore sponsorship from Gemini for IPL 2026, highlighting AI platforms' rising interest. Tata Group holds IPL title rights, while ChatGPT sponsors the Women’s Premier League.

articles.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang looks to reopen China market, plans another visit to country
articles.summary: Huang frequently travels to China during this time of year, and this visit coincides with a critical juncture for the most valuable firm in the world. The US is allowing Nvidia to sell its H200 model in the Asian country by easing export limits on AI processors.

articles.title: ReNew’s Sumant Sinha explains why 2026 could be a breakout year for India’s renewable energy sector
articles.summary: India’s rapid rise as a global solar powerhouse, combined with accelerating electrification and new growth areas such as green hydrogen and data centres, could mark a turning point for the country’s clean energy ambitions. ReNew Chairman and CEO Sumant Sinha says these structural shifts may position India as a major renewable energy hub as early as 2026, even as global energy markets remain fragmented by geopolitics.

articles.title: AI, digital economy and resilient consumers are powering 2026 growth despite tariffs and geopolitical risks: Mastercard CEO
articles.summary: Mastercard CEO Michael Miebach highlights how AI, digital innovation, and digitally empowered consumers are keeping global growth robust in 2026, despite trade tensions and geopolitical uncertainties. Cross-border spending, resilient supply chains, and early holiday shopping indicate a consumer-savvy economy ready for expansion.

articles.title: Delhi Airport to close third runway for upgradation and rehabilitation work from Feb 16
articles.summary: Delhi International Airport will rehabilitate Runway 11R/29L at Delhi airport from February 16, 2026, subject to regulatory approvals, with works including resurfacing, strengthening, a new rapid exit taxiway, and installation of a new instrument landing system, while maintaining the airport’s scheduled capacity of 1,514 daily movements and targeting recommissioning in early July, pending DGCA approval.

articles.title: PhonePe files updated draft papers with SEBI; Microsoft, Tiger Global to pare stake in OFS
articles.summary: The proposed IPO will be entirely an offer for sale, with no fresh issue component. Existing shareholders are looking to offload 5.07 crore shares through the offering.

articles.title: Donald Trump backs off again, says will not be implementing the February 1 tariffs over Greenland
articles.summary: Trump wrote on his social media that based on a very productive meeting that he had with NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte, they have formed the framework for a future deal with respect to Greenland, and the entire Arctic region.

articles.title: Wall Street bounces back after Donald Trump says he won’t use force to take Greenland
articles.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average was up 477 points, or 1%, as of 11 a.m. Eastern time, and the Nasdaq composite was 1.3% higher. Treasury yields also eased in the bond market, a day after jumping, in a potential signal of worries about higher inflation in the long term.

articles.title: MNS offers support to Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena in Kalyan Dombivli civic body
articles.summary: Shiv Sena MP Shrikant Shinde on Wednesday made the claim about the MNS offering support to his party. However, local MNS leaders could not be contacted despite attempts.

articles.title: TN Governor RN Ravi walks out of assembly, says 'was insulted, wasn't allowed to speak'
articles.summary: The Tamil Nadu Lok Bhavan alleged that the DMK government drafted address that contained “numerous unsubstantiated claims and misleading statements” while ignoring several pressing public concerns. Chief Minister MK Stalin strongly criticised the Governor RN's walkout. Read on:

articles.title: Advocates cannot seek information under RTI Act for clients' cases: CIC
articles.summary: The Central Information Commission (CIC) has ruled that advocates cannot use the Right to Information (RTI) Act to seek details regarding cases they are handling for clients, observing that using the transparency law in this manner fails to advance its core objectives.

articles.title: Mumbai Mayor race heats up as Shinde camps councillors amid coalition tussle
articles.summary: Eknath Shinde moved his Shiv Sena councillors to a Bandra hotel after BMC polls, according to News18 Hindi, intensifying the Mumbai mayoral race and making his faction a key player in Mahayuti alliance negotiations.

articles.title: Rahul to meet Indore water contamination victims, visit affected locality on Saturday
articles.summary: Gandhi will arrive in Indore on Saturday and meet affected persons undergoing treatment at Bombay Hospital, a private facility, he told reporters. The Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha would also visit Bhagirathpura and meet affected families to express condolences, he said.

articles.title: BJP to announce new national president on Jan 20; Nitin Nabin front-runner
articles.summary: If elected, Nabin will succeed JP Nadda, who has held the post since January 2020. Notably, Nadda had also followed a similar trajectory, having first been appointed as the BJP’s national working president in June 2019. Read on:

articles.title: Weather alert! Rain, snowfall in Jammu & Kashmir, Ladakh; hailstorm warning for Punjab
articles.summary: Thunderstorms with lightning and strong winds may also affect Haryana, Chandigarh and Delhi on January 23, while parts of West and East Rajasthan, western Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand could also see similar conditions. Read more:

articles.title: Birth certificate now sole proof for admissions, jobs in Nagaland
articles.summary: The Nagaland government has made birth certificates the sole mandatory document for school admissions, government employment and access to a range of official services.

articles.title: Delhi Police to deploy AI-enabled smart glasses with facial recognition for Republic Day security
articles.summary: For the first time, the Delhi Police will deploy AIenabled smart glasses equipped with an integrated facial recognition system (FRS) and thermal imaging technology as part of enhanced security measures for Republic Day celebrations, an official said on Wednesday.

articles.title: WEF 2026: UP secures ₹9,750 crore MoUs at Davos for clean energy, AI and defence projects
articles.summary: The UP government signed MoUs worth ₹9,750 crore at the WEF Annual Meeting 2026 as part of its push to position the state as a future-ready investment destination. The series of MoUs outlines a growing investment pipeline in clean energy, digital infrastructure, artificial intelligence and defence manufacturing.

articles.title: Sabarimala gold loss case: Kerala court grants bail to prime accused Unnikrishnan Potty
articles.summary: Unnikrishnan Potty gets bail in the Sreekovil gold loss case at Sabarimala but remains jailed for the Dwarapalaka idols case; SIT has arrested 12 including two former TDB presidents.

articles.title: Sudha Murthy warns public about AI-generated deepfake videos promising unrealistic investment returns
articles.summary: Sudha Murthy stated that she never discusses investments and that the statements made in these fake videos are false.

articles.title: Draft NEP 2026 Unveiled: Govt bets on clean power, market reforms and grid overhaul
articles.summary: The Draft National Electricity Policy (NEP) 2026 targets per capita electricity consumption of 2,000 kilowatt hours (kWh) by 2030, up from 1,460 kWh in 2024–25, and more than 4,000 kWh by 2047.

articles.title: Supreme Court seeks expert committee on Aravallis, orders stop to illegal mining
articles.summary: The Supreme Court of India has sought names of experts and environmentalists to form a panel on the Aravalli definition, ordered Rajasthan to stop illegal mining, and continued interim relief on mining rules.

articles.title: IAF trainee aircraft crashes in UP's Prayagraj, cause unknown yet
articles.summary: An Indian Air Force trainee aircraft crashed in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh on January 21. No casualties reported. The cause remains unknown and further details are awaited.

articles.title: Supreme Court grants interim protection to 3 accused in ₹3,500 crore AP liquor scam
articles.summary: The Supreme Court extended interim protection to three accused in the ₹3,500 crore Andhra Pradesh liquor scam, but declined to restore default bail, asking them to seek regular bail from the trial court.

articles.title: Four dead, six injured in high-speed crash in Udaipur
articles.summary: According to the police, the accident occurred near Nela Talab in the Savina area, and the four deceased were residents of Udaipur.

articles.title: BHIM Payments App sees fourfold rise in monthly transactions to 165 million in 2025
articles.summary: BHIM Payments App saw monthly transactions jump over 300% in 2025, rising from 39 million in January to 165 million in December, driven by wider UPI adoption for small and high-value payments.

articles.title: Quantum Energy, EMO Energy to launch e-scooter with 20-minute charging, 80-km range for fleets
articles.summary: Quantum Energy Limited has partnered with EMO Energy to launch a fast-charging electric scooter for last-mile delivery, targeting fleet operators with 20-minute charging and up to 80 km range.

articles.title: Noida techie death case: Car retrieved four days later, family seeks meeting with CM Yogi
articles.summary: As the investigation gathers momentum, Mehta’s family has sought a meeting with Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. Meanwhile, Former IPS officer Kiran Bedi described the case as one of “huge criminal negligence” and urged strict action. Read more:

articles.title: Republic Day 2026: President sends special invitations to distinguished citizens
articles.summary: Each year, India invites foreign leaders for the Republic Day parade, and their presence gets attention from around the world. This year, President of India has sent invites to Professor M. Krishnan, Dr G Natchiar, and EU leaders Ursula von der Leyen and Antonio Costa for Republic Day 2026 celebrations.

articles.title: Space race on with endeavour to return to Moon sustainably: Sunita Williams
articles.summary: Wearing a trademark deep blue space overalls and sporting a pair of space-themed canvas shoes, Williams, 60, strode into an auditorium full of Indian youths to a loud cheer, and later actively engaged with the audience with an unassuming ease, punctuating the conversation with delectable humour.

articles.title: India amends motor vehicle rules: No NOC, fitness renewal or permits if toll dues pending
articles.summary: The Government of India has amended the Motor Vehicles Rules to block NOCs, fitness renewals and national permits for vehicles with unpaid tolls logged in the Electronic Toll Collection system.

articles.title: TCS eyes AWS, OpenAI as anchor clients for Navi Mumbai data centre: Report
articles.summary: TCS and TPG are developing a Navi Mumbai data centre, targeting AWS and OpenAI as anchor clients. India’s AI infrastructure boom includes AdaniConneX, Google, Meta, Sify, and Reliance projects.

articles.title: NBSL, ASI in talks to allow ticket bookings using BHIM-UPI at heritage sites
articles.summary: NPCI-BHIM is in talks with the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) to enable BHIM UPI payments at all cultural heritage sites for booking tickets at the counter, a top official said on Wednesday.

articles.title: Deutsche Bank declares 'the honeymoon is over for AI' —‎ here's why
articles.summary: Deutsche Bank warns 2026 will be AI's toughest year, with rising anxiety, bottlenecks, and limited impact challenging global investment and optimism.

articles.title: Reports claiming OnePlus India shutting down are false, says CEO Robin Liu
articles.summary: OnePlus CEO Robin Liu confirms the company is operating as usual in India, dismissing shutdown rumours and urging stakeholders to verify information from official sources.

articles.title: Altman responds after Musk links ChatGPT to nine deaths, cites Autopilot crash toll
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman pushed back after Elon Musk shared an unverified claim linking ChatGPT to nine deaths and warned users away. Altman cited safety guardrails and Tesla Autopilot in response.

articles.title: Experience as digital foundation: The invisible architecture of human-centered transformation
articles.summary: Most digital transformations fail not because technology falls short, but because the design fails to reflect human behavior and the realities of daily work, notes Jagadeshwar Gattu, President – Digital Foundation Services at HCLTech.

articles.title: OpenAI says ChatGPT will change safety settings based on how old it thinks you are: All you need to know
articles.summary: OpenAI clarified that age verification is optional. Users aged 18 or above who wish to remove the additional safety settings can verify their age through ChatGPT’s settings using a third-party service, Persona. Read on:

articles.title: India’s young, tech-savvy base makes it crypto’s biggest grassroots market, says Binance’s Teng
articles.summary: Binance co-CEO Richard Teng highlights India’s top crypto adoption, global regulatory shifts, and aims for one billion users, with US and Europe advancing AI and blockchain clarity.

articles.title: OpenAI to debut first AI device in 2026: All about it
articles.summary: Lehane has kept the product's form secret, referring to it as a big attraction but stating that he'd have news to share "much later in the year."

articles.title: LTIMindtree eyes near double-digit revenue growth, confident of momentum extending into FY27
articles.summary: Venu Lambu, CEO of LTIMindtree, said the company is working on a five-year strategy that will be outlined by mid to end March, adding that the plan includes ambitious growth targets. He noted that if the company sustains its current growth momentum and successfully executes the new Horizons programme, there is no reason why this pace of growth cannot continue into FY27.

articles.title: India CEOs more confident than global peers, but increasingly wary of AI gaps and cyber risks: PwC survey
articles.summary: India CEOs show strong optimism for domestic growth and revenue, but face rising concerns over AI readiness, cybersecurity, and execution, according to PwC’s 29th Annual Global CEO Survey.

articles.title: Case against OpenAI for encouraging 'paranoid' man to murder his mother; Elon Musk reacts
articles.summary: Stein-Erik Soelberg, 56, killed his mother, Suzanne Eberson Adams, 83, before taking his own life in August 2025.

articles.title: From transformation to innovation, Davos signals next phase of enterprise AI adoption
articles.summary: Executives tell CNBC-TV18 that enterprises are moving past pilots to production-scale AI, opening new growth avenues for IT services firms

articles.title: These stocks are leading 'meaningful breakthroughs' in quantum computing, UBS says
articles.summary: Quantum computing is an industry with "extraordinary potential," according to UBS, which highlighted leading stocks.

articles.title: Indian IT set for AI-led growth spurt in 2026: Uniphore Chief Umesh Sachdeva
articles.summary: After a year of caution and uncertainty, Indian IT services companies are entering 2026 with clearer AI strategies and rising confidence. As enterprises move from pilot projects to large-scale, production-grade AI deployments, demand for AI-led services, agents and industry-specific solutions is creating a sustained growth opportunity for the sector, according to Uniphore CEO Umesh Sachdeva.

articles.title: Physical AI to become $1 trillion industry by 2030: HCLTech’s Vijayakumar
articles.summary: While acknowledging that some existing business lines may see deflation, he noted that the new opportunities are “exciting,” adding that HCLTech aims to scale its new service mines to $2.5 billion in the next two to three years

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Tech Mahindra eyes growth above industry average as turnaround gains momentum
articles.summary: Mohit Joshi, Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of Tech Mahindra, said margin expansion continues to be a key focus for the company, which remains on track to achieve its 15% operating margin target by FY27.

articles.title: Tata Technologies confident of double-digit topline growth in FY27
articles.summary: Warren Kevin Harris, MD and CEO of Tata Technologies, said margins are expected to improve in the fourth quarter, with the company targeting a return to around 18%, in line with FY25 levels, over the next financial year.

articles.title: Outlook 2026 | Healthcare — how data, AI, and next‑generation analytics are reshaping patient outcomes
articles.summary: The promise of healthcare in 2026 is clear: when data, AI, and next‑generation analytics work in harmony, they redefine what’s possible for patients and the way those possibilities are chosen, notes ZS' Regional Managing Principal, Mohit Sood.

articles.title: Elon Musk eyes chip market, says will resume work on Dojo3 project
articles.summary: Last week, Musk stated that the AI5 chip's design was "almost done" and that the AI6 chip was still in its early phases. Musk stated last year that Samsung Electronics Co. would manufacture the upcoming AI6 processor for Tesla.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence is making the global wealth gap even worse
articles.summary: According to a new Oxfam report, billionaire wealth increased three times faster in 2025 than the average annual rate over the previous five years. This period coincided with the AI-fueled stock market boom in the US.

articles.title: Varanasi police file 8 FIRs over alleged fake images of Manikarnika Ghat Project
articles.summary: Eight separate cases have been lodged in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi against those allegedly spreading AIgenerated images and misleading information on social media regarding the redevelopment work at the Manikarnika Ghat

articles.title: $600 billion investment in AI marks 'fastest large scale capital reallocation in modern history': WEF's Cathy Li
articles.summary: Cathy Li of the World Economic Forum also shared projections on the likely impact of artificial intelligence on the labour market.

articles.title: Tech wrap this week: Apple announces Creator Studio; Vivo, Redmi and Realme tease new products
articles.summary: From Apple’s Creator Studio launch to Google’s Veo update and new phones teased by Vivo, Redmi and Realme - here’s what changed in tech this week.

articles.title: OpenAI to test targeted ads in ChatGPT, stepping up revenue push
articles.summary: The ads will appear in the coming weeks for logged-in users of the free version of ChatGPT as well as a newer, lower-cost $8-a-month “Go” plan that first launched in India and is now expanding to the US, the company said Friday. The more expensive paid tiers of ChatGPT will remain free of ads.

articles.title: Tech hiring set to rise 12-15% in 2026: Adecco India
articles.summary: Overall tech hiring across permanent, temporary and contractual roles is set to rise 12-15% in 2026, adding nearly 1,25,000 new jobs as expansion continues across segments, according to workforce solutions provider Adecco India.

articles.title: Anthropic names Microsoft executive Irina Ghose as MD for India
articles.summary: Ghose, who has nearly three decades of experience scaling tech operations, will help ensure Anthropic's India approach is "grounded in local insight".

articles.title: Alchemy Capital introduces Series 3 AIF targeting listed and private Indian firms
articles.summary: Alchemy Capital Management launches Alchemy Long Term Ventures Fund, Series 3, led by Hiren Ved, targeting high-growth Indian companies in sectors like AI, defence, and healthcare.

articles.title: DSP Mutual Fund says ELSS isn’t just about tax: Is it still relevant under the new regime?
articles.summary: DSP Mutual Fund highlights ELSS as more than a tax-saving tool, citing its three-year lock-in and SIP approach as key to disciplined, long-term investing despite changing Section 80C relevance.

articles.title: PNB MetLife launches dividend-focused index fund under ULIP plans
articles.summary: PNB MetLife India Insurance launches Dividend Leaders Index Fund via GEM and Smart GEM ULIPs, tracking BSE 500 Dividend Leaders 50 Index, in partnership with Policybazaar.

articles.title: SBI to revise IMPS charges for high-value online transfers from February 15
articles.summary: SBI will add IMPS fees for transfers over ₹25,000 via online and mobile banking from Feb 15, with some accounts exempted.

articles.title: ICICI Prudential MF launches two long-short offerings under SIF segment
